provider.dc:description: The Cornwall College Group is committed to enriching the lives and creating new opportunities for all members of the Cornish community. This is reflected in our mission statement: “To provide learners with a high quality experience, celebrated through vocational and academic achievement, personal development and employability.
provider.dc:title: Cornwall College

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.

This course is for anyone who has an interest in Engineering and is able to attend either full time or on a day release. For those having gained an apprenticeship who wish to study on a day release basis and for non apprentice students on a full time basis.
course.dc:subject: 2330 electrotechnical technology engineering lean eal soar
course.dc:title: Engineering Technology EMTA Diploma Level 2
course.learningOutcome: Upon successful completion of this course you can progress on to a level 3 qualification within a variety of engineering pathways.
course.mlo:objective:
The qualification focuses on practical skills and knowledge.  This ensures that when the learner completes the qualification they will have gained practical experience and a high expectation of some of the situations that they could face in a job role within the engineering sector.  This qualification has been designed to give a 'hands on' practical approach to engineering training.  It enhances foundation level knowledge supporting employer requirements.

You will cover six units of performing engineering operations supported by a technical certificate.

  1. Working safely in an engineering environment
  2. Carrying out engineering activities efficiently and effectively
  3. Using and communicating technical information
  4. Producing components using hand fitting techniques
  5. Preparing and using lathes for turning operations
  6. Producing plate work components and assemblies
course.mlo:prerequisite: For under 19s, a minimum of 4 GCSE passes at Grade D or above are required or Level 1 Engineering & Technology.  Mature applicants without formal qualifications but with experience in work-related areas are encouraged to apply.   All will be assessed at interview.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

mlo:location.mlo:address: Cornwall College Units 24/ 25 Sisna Park Road Estover Plymouth

course.dc:description: The course is part of the Progression Pathways offer at Cornwall College although it can also be studied outside of this package if preferred as a stand alone qualification.  This course is for anyone who wishes to improve their ICT skills.  Functional Skills ICT is offered from Entry Level through to Level 2.
course.dc:subject: vocation, hands-on, numeracy, literacy,
Information & Communication Technology
course.dc:title: ICT Functional Skills City & Guilds Level 2
course.mlo:objective: Functional skills ICT is designed to develop and assess functional ICT from entry level 1 to level 2 to ensure clear progression pathways and personal development opportunities. The qualification and assessment are intended to enhance skills application across a range of contexts. The knowledge, skills and problem-solving approaches contained within the qualification provide tools that can be utilised in work, life and further learning. This qualification will encourage learners to demonstrate their using ICT, finding and selecting information and developing, presenting and communicating information skills and are designed to develop and recognise the ability of learners to apply and transfer skills in ways that are appropriate to their situation. Functional skills are recognised as vital to learner’s personal development, increasing both confidence and effectiveness.
course.mlo:prerequisite: Ideally you will have an ICT qualification at Level 1 but an initial assessment will be carried out to esnsure you are placed on the most appropriate level.

course.dc:description:
This course is offered at various sites across Cornwall and Devon.

  • Occombe Farm, Paignton, South Devon. The course is centred around sustainable production of a range of food crops where you will cover all aspects of production under cover (Polytunnels), in raised beds and outdoor production.
  • Duchy College,Rosewarne  (Green Fingers) where you will work within the extensive grounds, glasshouses and polytunnels and the Nursery and within the local community.
  • Heaven Scent, Wheel Martyn, St Austell within the Nursery and surrounding grounds.

Ideal if: you would like to improve your horticultural skills and knowledge, whilst gaining a nationally-recognised qualification.

You'll need: at least a GCSE at grade E or above in English and Mathematics, or an equivalent qualification. You will also need to have a keen interest in gardening and the environment.

You'll learn: about propagation, establishing plants, identification of plants, care and maintenance of plants, understanding the growing environment for plants and an introduction to common pests, diseases and their control.

Expect: your assignments and projects to be assessed throughout the course, and of course to get your hands dirty!

You'll love: learning about all aspects of production including polytunnels, raised beds and outdoors.

You'll go onto: a Level 2 Horticulture Apprenticeship or Diploma in which there is the opportunity to specialise in a particular area of horticulture if you so wish.
course.dc:subject: Practical Horticulture, gardening, gardener, landscaper, landscape, landscape gardening, botany
Horticulture
course.dc:title: Practical Horticulture Skills City & Guilds Certificate Level 1 (XF)
course.abstract: Learn all about sustainable produce, plant identification and the principles behing plant and soil science.
course.learningOutcome: You may wish to further your knowledge and skills on a Work-based level 1 course, a level 2 course or by attending modules that specialise in a specific area of Horticulture.
course.mlo:objective: This course will cover a range of tasks including propagation, establishing plants, identification of plants, care and maintenance of plants, understanding the growing environment for plants and an introduction to common pests, diseases and their control.
course.mlo:prerequisite: A keen interest and enthusiasm in the production of plants and crops. Prepared to get your hands dirty within a range of practical Horticultural situations.

presentation.dc:title: Practical Horticulture Skills City & Guilds Certificate Level 1 (Heaven Scent)

course.dc:description:
Who is this course for?

This course is for those people considering starting Access in September 2016 who would like to improve their study skills and confidence before starting.

This course is also suitable for anyone who is hoping to return to education but who might not be sure which route to take.

What will this course give you?

This course will give you the confidence to progress in education. It will give you the core study skills needed to succeed in future higher level courses. It will also help you to explore future career options and identify suitable education routes.

Where is the course?

The course is taught at the St Austell campus

When is the course?

The course starts on Friday 8th January and runs every Friday for 20 weeks between 9.30am – 3.30pm.
course.dc:subject: Employment Work Experience English & Maths qualifications Curriculum Vitae (CV) Presentation Skills Team Building, Communication Skills Business Enterprise, Personal challenges
Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Progression AptEd Certificate Level 2
course.abstract: Develops study and employability skills, explores future course and career options
course.mlo:assessment: You are assessed on the content and quality of set unit work at Level 2 but given feedback that you will be able to apply at Level 3.
course.learningOutcome: Support will be given to progress into work or onto further and higher level training in a wide range of subjects.
course.mlo:objective:
• Academic writing and referencing
  • Study skills
  • Career options
  • Stress management
  • Presentation software and skills
  • Problem solving
  • Critical thinking
  • Teamwork and communication
course.mlo:prerequisite:
What will it cost?

There are no formal entry requirements. All applicants will be invited for an interview and will complete an online assessment of their English and Maths skills to determine if the course is the most suitable route.

The course costs £200. You may be eligible to get the course fee paid if:

  • If you are aged between 19-23 and you do not have a full level 2 qualification there will be no charge.
  • If you are over 19, unemployed, looking for work and in receipt of a state benefit there will be no charge.

presentation.dc:title: Progression AptEd Certificate Level 2
presentation.mlo:assessment: You are assessed on the content and quality of set unit work at Level 2 but given feedback that you will be able to apply at Level 3.

course.dc:description:
Courses at the Heaven Scent Nursery at Wheal Martyn are designed for adult learners who will benefit from a relaxed and informal environment in which to build skills and knowledge in horticulture and conservation.  Starting at entry level and progressing to Level 2, these part-time practical courses are a great way to get fit, feel good, and gain a vocational qualification that can help in securing employment.  The environment is particularly suited to anyone who might find attendance at one of the main college campuses difficult.

Courses cover sustainable horticulture, wildlife gardening, organic gardening methods, garden maintenance, propagation and health and safety.  This is a small working nursery so there is also the opportunity to develop important employability and enterprise skills. Working as part of a group in a supportive environment helps to improve confidence and independence as well as  communication skills.

course.dc:description: For further information you can call the College on 01726 226 or visit www.cornwall.ac.uk/staustell  Impartial careers advice and guidance is also available from the College.  Financial support for childcare and transport may also be available, subject to meeting criteria.

This course is suitable for anyone who wants to study on and Access course or other Level 3 qualification. This course would particularly suit those returning to education who would like to research their options, gain academic skills and confidence in a friendly and supportive environment.
course.dc:title: Award In Progression apt awards Level 3 (QCF) (M)
course.learningOutcome: Students can progress onto an Access Diploma course in a range of subjects or other vocational qualifications.
course.mlo:objective:
You will study three units over the duration of 10 weeks, attending college twice a week (Thursday and Friday).  The college day will be 10.00am- 3.00pm.  You will study a range of subjects that build on existing skills and prepare you for academic study.


Course units are:  Personal Study Skills, Personal Career Planning and Presentation Software. 

Assessment will take the form of coursework, presentations or in-class assessments, depending on the unit that you are studying.
course.mlo:prerequisite: Successful completion of initial assessment at interview with results of level 1 or above in both maths and English.

course.dc:description: Three models required and a hairdressing kit.

You can choose from  Traditional Black & White Film or more current techniques for using Digital Cameras and software - we have the course for you!

 Dispense with digital. Find film. Adopt analogue. Learn the four principles of all image making.  Get right back to understanding how using basic techniques can improve your image making, all on  silver-based  photographic film and paper. Using black and white film, make your images, process your films and print onto photographic paper in an old-fashioned darkroom. Join us in a red-lit darkroom and have some old-fashioned fun.

Hours of fun with your camera.  Learn how to use Adobe's Photoshop program and techniques to create exciting texts, images and layouts.  Learn how to get the best out of your camera. Whether restoring old photographs or manipulating new ones, our Photoshop  course is the one  for you.

DIgital cameras are a modern way to capture precious moments and spectaular views, if you don't know how to get the best out of your digital camera then one of our workshops could be  the answer!

Basic practical theory of camera controls, film processing and darkroom work which underpins all creative picture taking

We also offer a range of courses related to Photography, both digital and traditional, please call 0845 22 32 567 for more details.

course.mlo:prerequisite: No qualifications are required, just a passion for photography.

course.dc:description:
Nancy Finch Reiki Stage 2 Tutor  Nancy joins our ACL team to deliver our Reiki Practioner programme.   She brings a wealth of experience, qualifications and knowledge to this area and has developed the Stage 2 course to include - ethics, professional boundaries and confidentiality, understanding symbols, practical treatments and attunements.   This course is suitable for those with a Stage / Level 1 and for those wishing to revisit their Reiki practice.

Disharmony almost always begins with a belief system. Patterns of self limiting beliefs - I am not good enough, I feel guilty, I am afraid to - from where negative emotions arise, can create an imbalance in the body. Reiki training will help you gently let go of these beliefs that serve no purpose to you, finding peace and healing in a safe environment.

Reiki is a very simple technique to master and is an energy technique where natural healing vibrations are transmitted through the hands of a Reiki practitioner (acting as a conduit) to the body of the recipient. The purpose of Reiki is to relieve stress and pain, induce relaxation, release emotional blockages, accelerate natural healing, balance energies and enhance peace.

Reiki is a simple yet profound system of hands on healing, developed in Japan that transcends cultural and religious boundaries.  It is also a gentle yet powerful path to personal and spiritual growth.  Reiki can have a profound effect on health and well being by rebalancing, cleansing and renewing your internal energy system.
course.dc:subject: holistic , complementary therapy , reiki , Reiki shares , healing , colour energy , Cornwall College St Austell

course.dc:description:
BOOKING ESSENTIAL - 0845 22 32 567

Barre Concept is a unique workout that combines the elements of Pilates, Yoga, resistance training and Ballet into a highly effective regime performed on the mat and at a ballet barre. The technique utilises the body's own resistance. The effect is a long, lean dancers body without being a dancer! The low impact, total body workout lifts the butt, tones the thighs, flattens the abs and sculpts the arms, whilst protecting the joints. Small isometric contractions are performed and integrated with an interval training approach that burns fat and improves cardiovascular fitness. Posture, flexibility, stamina and core strength improve. The result is a body that is realigned, rebalanced and works harmoniously and efficiently. Classes are performed to music ensuring a buzzing and vibrant atmosphere to get sweaty in!! The classes are suitable for all ages and especially people with NO experience of dance as
well as those that have.
course.dc:subject: Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: BarreConcept (JM)
course.abstract: new course using the barre as a resource to get fit and supple.
course.learningOutcome: This course will run over 3 terms so once you have  completed the first 10 weeks you can sign up for the next sessions and improve  your skills.
course.mlo:objective: The class is called Barre Concept, it's a mixture of ballet, pilates and yoga moves performed at the barre and in the centre and is suitable for all ages and especially people with NO experience of dance as well as those that have. Our tutor, Jessica Leonard, is  a qualified Barre Concept instructor, please check out the website for more info; https://www.barreconcept.co.uk/

course.dc:description:
Come along and learn the basics of ballroom dancing.  In these  5 weeks we will cover Waltz, Quickstep, Social Foxtrot, Cha Cha Cha and Jive.  This will not cover sequence dancing.  Don’t worry if you haven’t a partner, the tutor and her partner will be able to dance with you if there are no other ‘spare’ people around!

At the end of the course you should have the confidence to get up and dance at any social function. 

 Please wear comfortable footwear but no sharp  / stiletto heels

Karen Lane runs her own dance school and has taught various dance classes  at Cornwall College  since 2002. She is a former All England Champion  and Bluebell Girl and brings a wonderful sense of fun to all her sessions.

course.dc:description: The intermediate level course deals with Progression from beginners course and develops the basic cake decorating and design skills, introduced on the previous course

We offer a great programme of cake decorating to suit all requirements .  The Basic Cake Decorating  course is suitable for anyone who wants to learn how to use basic  skills and improve on current knowledge.  We offer a 10 week programme to cover the introductory skills and will follow up with another 10 week programme learning  more advanced techniques.   We will also be offering Saturday masterclasses and workshops for specific cupcake designs and special occasions.  These workshops deliver skills and techniques to create individual masterpieces to impress family and friends.

We offer a range of cake making and decorating courses at our Camborne,  St Austell and Saltash sites.  Our tutors have a wealth of skills and qualifications to ensure you develop techniques and gain experience to produce your own creatively designed and decorated cakes.

course.dc:description:
This course runs on Saturday mornings.

This course is perfect if you are a complete beginner or have limited welding knowledge, Ideal if you want to learn a new skill, if you are creative, if you want to repair your own car or even a garden gate.     

On this course you will gain a basic understanding of the different Welding processes used in industry and at home.     You can choose from some or all of the following welding processes including:    

  • MMA-Manual Metal ARC (Stick)  
  • MAGS-Metal Arc Gas Shielded (Mig)  
  • TIG-Tungsten Inert Gas   
  • GAS-Oxy-Acetylene  

You could cover Flat and Horizontal/Vertical (downhand), single weld beads, re-joining of runs, build-up weld runs to form a weld pad, welding Tee fillet and Butt welds, Inside and Outside Corner Joints on 1.6 - 6mm thick mild steel.

Welding leisure courses are run at both Camborne and St Austell sites as a way of introducing the skills to enable you to progress onto a qualfication or as a continuation onto another leisure course.
course.dc:subject: Engineering
course.dc:title: Welding Skills - ARC/MIG (M)
course.abstract: A series of welding sessions leading to a qualification
course.learningOutcome: Cornwall College offers a wide range of qualfications, apprenticeships and traineeships within this field, or you could consider a further leisure course. You can return to this course and take up another welding process or you can join the British Standard 4872 Basic to Advanced course.
course.mlo:objective: During and by the end of this training course you will with confidence, be able to set up and use the equipment safely. You will learn the health and safety aspects of welding, how to set the welding parameters and electrical conditions including amps, volts and gas pressures, relevant to the material to be joined and process required. Material removal processes including Grinding, Plasma cutting and Gas Cutting can also be demonstrated if required. Small group sizes ensure that you have lots of personal tuition and supervision from an experienced tutor with many years of teaching and commercial welding experience.

course.dc:title: Art and Design OCR GCE AS-level (Fine Art)

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description: The course will appeal to students who want to communicate their ideas visually, are interested in the relationship between art and photography, enjoy looking at and discussing photographic work and want to engage with practical project-based photography.

There will be five hours per week supervised tuition. At A-level you are expected to take responsibility for your own learning and to work in your own time with the support and advice of your lecturers. You will need to undertake much of the practical work involved in your own time, particularly at weekends.
You will be expected to prepare for lessons by reading and, usually, making your own notes and you will be required to research the work of historical and contemporary photographers and develop an understanding and appreciation of their working methods.
course.dc:title: Art AQA GCE A2-level (Photography)
course.learningOutcome:
At the end of the course you should have developed a strong ability to communicate your ideas through the medium and have developed a sense of visual literacy that allows you to appreciate the language of photography, painting and film.

Entry to Higher Education photographic courses is contingent on a strong portfolio of work and this course will provide you with the opportunity to develop a portfolio for application to HE institutions.

Many students see photography as a unique bridge between art and science and combine it with other courses to add breadth to their education. Photography also works well in conjunction with art or media based programmes.
course.mlo:objective:
The majority of the course is based on the practical production of your own photographs. The programme is divided into four modules:

  • The Studio; in which students are taught about studio lighting and techniques.
  •  The Street; in which students complete a documentary assignment.
  •  The Land; in which students respond to ideas and approaches toward photographing the landscape.

The fourth module is concerned with responding to the examination question paper. You will also be given contextual studies′ lectures which explore the work of a number of significant historical and contemporary photographers and the ideas and techniques behind their work.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Five GCSE grades at C or above, plus the successful completion of AS level to grade C in this subject. 

It is sometimes possible for mature students to do A level Photography in one year by taking the AS level and A2 course concurrently. This is largely dependent upon experience and ability.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description: The new GCSE English Language course gives learners the opportunity to explore a vibrant range of genres and writers. GCSE English Language is a very important qualification for your future employment and progression. Most employers and universities still require you to have a Grade 5 or above in GCSE English Language to apply for a place.
course.dc:subject: Preparation for Life & Work
course.dc:title: English Language AQA GCSE Level 2
course.abstract: GCSE English Language
course.mlo:assessment: The GCSE English Language course requires learners to sit two final exams.  You will also complete a speaking and listening assessment.
course.learningOutcome: GCSE English Language provides a foundation for AS and A-level study as well as progression to other further and higher education courses.
course.mlo:objective:
GCSE English Language will allow you to study a wide range of extracts from the 19th, 20th and 21st centuries, including literature and literary non-fiction.
You will develop your reading skills, evaluating texts critically and making comparisons between texts.
You will use the knowledge you gain from your reading to develop your own writing.
You will learn to write effectively and coherently using Standard English appropriately.
course.mlo:prerequisite: The good news is you don’t need any formal qualifications or experience to gain entry onto this course. You will need a high degree of self-motivation and enthusiasm for the subject area. You will also be invited for an informal interview to determine suitability.

course.dc:description:
This course is for those who have had difficulty settling into their chosen study programme, who may need further support with Functional Skills, or who have experienced personal issues that have preventing them from achieving  their goal.

City & Guilds' Employability and Personal Development qualifications help you to demonstrate that you have the personal skills, qualities and attitudes needed by employers. They will help you to look for, obtain and maintain employment. By developing your skills and confidence, these qualifications may also help you progress into further education and learning.

  • Level 2 Award in Employability and personal development
  • Level 2 Certificate in Employability and personal development
  • Level 1 BTEC in Home cooking skills
  • Level 2 Award in Barista Skills
  • Function Skills in English and Maths (if required)

 

There are also opportunities to try out other vocational subjects, for example:

  • Photography
  • Catering
  • Art

course.dc:description:
All students are encouraged to bring male clients to the course. We would also recommend that you purchase a male block as some work can also be achieved on this. Cornwall College could help you with this additional cost. For further information, please follow the link:

Learner Support Bursary Fund

This course is offered as a separate qualification for both qualified hairdressers and those working towards a hairdressing qualification.

This is also offered as an additionality if you are studying a full time Level 2 or level 3 programme within the hairdressing department.

Men's hairdressing and barbering is a specialist skill and is currently in demand with the growth of the men's hairdressing and barbering industry. The Men's City and Guilds cutting award is taught by an experienced barbering specialist and includes theory work, demonstrations and hands-on workshops. Endorsed by Habia, this qualification is a useful addition to your training and could help you progress in your current employment. You may also run your own salon and wish to offer Men's styling and barbering as an additional service.
course.dc:subject: Barbering Hairdressing Hair Men Mens Beauty
Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Cutting Men's Hair CG Award Level 2
course.abstract: Mens hairdressing and barbering is a specialist skill and currently in demand
course.learningOutcome:
You could continue your studies with Cornwall College by upgrading to a level 3 and 4 qualification in Hair or add extra units to the Barbering qualification. Cornwall College offer pathways in Hair, Beauty and Holistics and you could diversify by studying additional qualifications.

The level 2 in Barbering is an excellent route if you are looking for employment and a career in gents cutting and grooming techniques.
course.mlo:objective:
You will train in our professionally run salon under supervision of our barbering expert who will guide you through layering, club cutting, the scissor over comb method, use of clippers and free-hand cutting techniques.

You will also acquire the knowledge necessary to undertake different styles, recognise different hair types, groom men's facial hair, work with natural hairlines and baldness and consult with clients on after care.

All workshops are hands-on. You will be given demonstrations and lectures in support of your practical training and theory is assessed by online multiple choice tests.
course.mlo:prerequisite: Typical applicants for this course are qualified hairdressers or working towards a level 2 or 3 hairdressing qualification. You may also be looking to refresh your knowledge in Barbering.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description:
This qualification aims to develop your knowledge and understanding of airline operations and aviation operations on the ground. You will learn the importance of health, safety and security procedures in the aviation industry and be introduced to the different terminology used. You will identify airport locations and the types of flights handled by each airport, the passengers using scheduled and chartered flights and key destinations for each group. You will understand how to deal with customer complaints and incidences.

The qualification enables you to understand the importance of teamwork and you will have the opportunity to start developing team working skills. You will identify your personal skills, qualities, qualifications and experiences and relate them to potential job roles in the aviation industry.
course.dc:title: Exploring the Aviation Industry NCFE Certificate Level 1
course.mlo:objective:
The qualification consists of the following units which support the development of aviation knowledge and understanding:

  • Unit 1 - The aviation industry

  • Unit 2 - Aviation terminology

  • Unit 3 - Airport locational geography

  • Unit 4 - Customer service in aviation

  • Unit 5 - Teamwork in the aviation industry

  • Unit 6 - Preparation for entry to employment in the aviation industry

presentation.dc:title: Exploring the Aviation Industry NCFE Certificate Level 1

course.dc:description: This qualification is aimed at the learner who wants to pursue a career in the health and fitness industry as a fitness instructor in the context of gym-based exercise.

Two full days a week, days TBC.

Attendance of 95% is compulsory unless extenuating circumstances apply.

At Cornwall College we pride ourselves in the expert teaching we provide our students with but also the excellent support that we provide alongside all of our programmes, treating all students equally and fairly.

Your attendance, attitude, aptitude and performance on your course will be monitored regularly by your course tutor and course manager. If any of the above are a cause for concern your course tutor will address these with you.

If support is required it may be provided on a one-to-one basis or extra revision sessions in the lead up to the exams for those requesting it for example. If required you may be placed on a supportive action plan to get you back on track - our aim is to get you to achieve.

The department also has a senior tutor who may be involved in discipline matters or to provide support if required.
course.dc:subject: gym instructor fitness instructor personal trainer
Sport
course.dc:title: Fitness Instructing YMCA Certificate Level 2
course.abstract: If you are looking to enter the leisure industry as a gym instructor then this qualification is a great starting point.
course.mlo:assessment:
You will be assessed in the following ways:

  • by compleing various Worksheets
  • 1 x A&P Theory Exam
  • 1 x Exercise, Fitness Knowledge Theory Exam
  • 1 Hour Practical Exam

Formative, mock examinations with be carried out throughout the programme to support you in preparation for the theory exams.
course.learningOutcome:
Upon successful completion of the CYQ level two Fitness Instructing Gym Based Exercise course, students will be able to programme and instruct in the gym environment carrying out safe practice. 


Upon successful completion of the level 2 course and a successful interview you may then be able to progress onto the CYQ level 3 Certificate in Personal Training which includes nutrition, fitness testing and personal training programming and delivery. 


On completion of the CYQ level two Fitness Instructing Exercise to Music course, students will have the skills and knowledge to programme and deliver safe and effective exercise to music sessions for a range of clients.


All courses allow successful learners to apply to be on the Register of Exercise Professionals (REPS). This means that they meet strict industry standards to deliver exercise advice and/or demonstration. To protect the public, all registered exercise professionals are bound by a code of ethical practice that covers professional standards and conduct.


At both campus's we also look to employ apprentices qualified in gym instructing to run our campus gyms and complete an apprenticeship in Personal Training - more information avaiable on request.
course.mlo:objective:
You will be taught by highly qualified and voacionally experienced lecturers at both sites.

The topics you will study are as follows;

    • anatomy and physiology including:
      - the heart and circulatory system
      - the respiratory system
      - structure and function of the skeleton
      - musculoskeletal system
      - postural and core stability
      - the nervous and energy systems and their relation to exercie

    • how to maintain health, safety and welfare in a variety of fitness environments, including the safeguarding of children and vulnerable adults

    • how to programme safe and effective exercise for a range of clients, the health benefits of physical activity and the importance of healthy eating

    • how to communicate with clients effectively, and motivate clients to adhere to an exercise programme

    • the skills and knowledge required to plan and prepare a gym-based exercise programme with apparently healthy adults - both individuals and groups. This may include young people in the 14-16 age range, provided they are part of a larger adult group. Client groups also covered are older adults, ante and postnatal clients and disabled clients provided the relevant contraindications and key safety guidelines are observed
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Candidates must be over 16 at time of interview and have a passion for the fitness industry.

Having a grade C or level 2 equivalent in English and Maths is desirable - if you do not hold one or either of these qualifications the college can support you to complete these alongside this course as part of your study programme*.

*more information available on request

You will be required to complete a pre-course workbook and complete a mock examination during your induction day to assess your level of anatomy & physiology knowledge

If you have acheived a level 2 qualification previous we will be looking for a minimum of a Merit in the anatomy & physiology units.

presentation.dc:subject: Sport
presentation.dc:title: Fitness Instructing YMCA Certificate Level 2 (Gym-Based Exercise)
presentation.mlo:assessment:
You will be assessed in the following ways:

  • by compleing various Worksheets
  • 1 x A&P Theory Exam
  • 1 x Exercise, Fitness Knowledge Theory Exam
  • 1 Hour Practical Exam

Ideal if: you want to work in the motor industry in behicle maintenance and repair, or if you are already in the industry and wish to gain a recognised qualification.

course.dc:subject: motec 1 vehicle maintenance auto automotive car
Motor Vehicle
course.dc:title: Vehicle Maintenance IMIAL Certificate Level 1
course.abstract: This course is ideal if you are looking to work in the motor industry in vehicle maintenance and repair
course.mlo:assessment: You will be continually assessed throughout the course.
course.learningOutcome:
This course forms part of a collection of Institute of The Motor Industry Awards offered at Cornwall College. Holding a qualification from The Institute of the Motor Industry will show colleagues and employers that you have a professional and recognised qualification which is much respected in the industry.

There are a number of roles available to you in the Motor Industry once you have the right qualifications; from working on Body Repair in the workshop to working in the Fast Fit industry, providing parts or even running your own garage. Cornwall College offer the full package of qualifications and support to help you get there. Once you have completed Motec, you could choose from Light and Heavy Vehicle Maintenance, Accident Repair, Vehicle Fitting and Parts Operations to apprenticeships in Paint and Body Repair.
course.mlo:objective:
You will be training in our state of the art motor vehicle department and learning how to use the tools and equipment of the motor vehicle trade. This course offers study in Workshop Safety, Engine Systems, Cooling and Lubrication, Steering and Suspension, Braking Systems, Wheels and Tyres and Electrical Foundation Skills.

Students will work on a variety of vehicles and most assessments are task based which means less exams and more practical time in the workshop! Cornwall College want to engage you as much as possible and we aim to provide you with both stimulating and relevant training.

There is also some classroom study to enable you to understand the technology that makes a vehicle work and as we want you to succeed on the course and prepare you for working life, you will also complete Functional Skills in Maths, English and IT.

Motec 1 is a 6 month course and runs from September to February and allows for progression to Motec 2 which runs from February to June in the following academic year.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Students on this course will usually hold 3 GCSE grade Ds in English, Maths and Science.

If you are unsure as to whether or not you meet the requirements, please ring Cornwall College on 0845 2232567 and speak to one of our advisors who will be happy to discuss this with you. You will be accepted onto the course with a satisfactory interview and initial assessment.

course.dc:description:
This course is suitable for 16-19 year olds or mature applicants seeking entry into the vehicle accident repair industry. Not only will you learn how to repair bodywork and practice welding techniques, you will also gain the practical skills and know-how to rectify paint defects and carry out surface enhancement.

The qualification as with all of our Motor Vehicle courses takes a highly practical approach and we aim to stimulate as well as engage you. If you are a hands-on person that prefers to learn by doing then this course may be for you.

This Level 1 diploma is ideal for those learners who wish to undertake a qualification which will support their progress to a higher level diploma.

course.dc:title: Vehicle Maintenance IMIAL Diploma Level 1 (Body Tech)
course.abstract: This course is suitable for 16-19 year olds or mature applicants seeking entry into the vehicle accident repair industry
course.learningOutcome:
This course forms part of a collection of IMI awards offered at Cornwall College. Holding a qualification from The Institute of the Motor Industry will show colleagues and employers that you have a professional and recognised qualification which is much respected in the industry.

Progression from this course can take you onto various qualifications. Typically, learners on this course will progress onto the Level 2 Diploma in Vehicle Accident Repair Paint Principles or Vehicle Accident Repair Paint Competence.

There are a number of roles available to you in the Motor Industry once you have the right qualifications; from working on Body Repair in the workshop to working in the Fast Fit industry, providing parts or even running your own garage. Cornwall College offer the full package of qualifications and support to help you get there.
course.mlo:objective:
You will be attending the college, 3 days a week, training in our state of the art workshops, learning the basic principles of body repair. There are a number of units that must be completed in order to gain the full qualification covering everything from Health and Safety, Tools and Materials, Vehicle Construction, Forming and Joining Principles of Component fitting, Basic Vehicle Preparation and many more.

Most assessments are completed in the workshops on a range of vehicle panels. You will also learn panel and door removal techniques and study the technology behind vehicle body repair.

Vehicle Refinishing also forms part of this course and you will learn basic skills of paint spraying in preparation of the level 2 diploma.

As we want you to succeed on this course and prepare you for work in the motor vehicle industry, you will also complete Functional skills in English, Maths and ICT.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
Applicants should have a good grasp of English and Maths GCSE C/D and a keen desire to succeed on the course. You will be accepted onto the course with a satisfactory interview and initial assessment.

If you are unsure about the suitability of this course, please ring Cornwall College on 0845 2232567 and speak to one of our advisors who will be happy to discuss this with you.

course.abstract: An entry level course ideal for starting your career.
course.learningOutcome:
This course forms part of a collection of automotive qualifications offered at Cornwall College. Holding a qualification will show colleagues and employers that you have a professional and recognised qualification which is much respected in the industry.

Now that you have experienced the different aspects of the automotive industry, you may like to progress onto a level 1 qualification with Cornwall College. Students usually gain another year's training before entering the workplace and will generally progress onto a level 1 course. This course will go into greater depth in the areas of your choice of study.
course.mlo:objective:
The course is highly practical and you will practice a range of vehicle maintenance skills. Starting from the beginning, you will be introduced to workshop safety, tools and equipment as well as the different roles within the automotive industry. With the support of the centre, you will study a number of modules from simple body repair and engine operation through to routine checks and vehicle construction.

Cornwall College want to engage you as much as possible and we aim to provide you with both stimulating and relevant training. Most assessments are task based which means less exams and more practical time in the workshop!

As we want you to succeed on the course and prepare you for working life, you will also complete Functional Skills in Maths, English and IT.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
There are no specific requirements; however you must be keen with a desire to succeed on the course and progress onto higher levels. 

If you are unsure about the suitability of this course, please ring Cornwall College on 0845 2232567 and speak to one of our advisors who will be happy to discuss this with you.

We welcome visits from prospective students. It is hard to know if a course is right for you without actually meeting the tutors and current students and seeing the work that is produced.... so give us a call and come and see for yourself!

 

For further information please contact the Course Manager, Jamie Hanson.

+44 (0)1209 617 654 jamie.hanson@cornwall.ac.uk

UCAS Code: W902
Institution Code: CORN C78

The BA (Hons) Top-up Degree in Contemporary Creative Practice at Cornwall College brings together our Higher Education expertise in Graphic Design, Animation, Multimedia, Fine Art, Ceramics, Fine Art Textiles, Photography and 3D Design, into a new and vibrant interdisciplinary course.

This course is designed for anybody wishing to further their study from a relevant level 5 art & design programme

All modules are core modules:

  • Concept Development and Practice CORC315
  • Dissertation CORC316
  • Negotiated Extended Practice CORC317
  • Professional Practice CORC318
course.dc:subject: BA(Hons), Graphic Design Animation Fine Art Ceramics Textiles Furniture Design interdisciplinary creative practice art and design design art foundation degree foundation degree Contemporary Creative Practice
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: BA (Hons) Contemporary Creative Practice
course.abstract: This course is designed for anybody wishing to further their study from a relevant level 5 art and design programme.
course.learningOutcome:
A graduate from this course will be self-motivated, questioning and knowledgeable, and be able to see themselves, as a positive agent of change in the current art and design landscape. Therefore there are many possible avenues of employment to pursue, including work in a design studio or graduates may wish to set up their own art & design practice. Further academic study includes a variety of art & design teaching qualifications or post graduate study at MA level.

Students completing the BA (Honours) Contemporary Creative Practice are eligible to apply for MA courses in relevant disciplines.  Potential routes for further, MA levels of study at Plymouth University are:

  • MA Contemporary Art Practice
  • MA Contemporary Designer Maker
  • MA Design
  • MA Publishing

There are also potential routes of employment through teacher training at Plymouth University; courses include MA Education and PGCE Art & Design (Secondary).  There are also relevant, post graduate teacher training courses at Cornwall College School of Education & Training.

The Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression. 

Contact details:

Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9 - 4.00 pm)

Alternatively you can email any questions to kathleen.pope@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
The course provides an invigorating blend of traditional, contemporary and innovative approaches to learning, and is unique to Cornwall and the South West.

Today's artists and designers have to be highly adaptable individuals, constantly moving between different methods of work. Our course responds to the professional reality of the contemporary creative industry, preparing students to respond imaginatively within a range of professional situations.

As a student on the course you will have the opportunity to gain experience in collaboration, communication, creative enterprise, design, digital media, image making, installation, animation, materials innovation, textiles, ceramics, metals, glassware, furniture making, model-making, mark making, plastics, print, professional practice, public art, and film.

To enrich the studio experience and enable you to develop the necessary skills and expertise for a successful future, the programme also includes critical studies, enterprise studies, professional practice, computer applications and workshop options. 

Students will also benefit from the Sustainable Practice and Creative Enterprise (SPaCE) initiative. SPaCE ensures students receive appropriate work-based learning and through partners and external agencies students will advised and set projects and live briefs to work on, either individually or collaboratively. SPaCE gives opportunities to collaborate and try out ideas within in a supportive environment whilst mirroring the common project-based work structure used in creative industries.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
The official minimum entry requirement is 240 credits from a level 4 & 5 art & design programme, such as a successfully completed Foundation Degree or HND.

All applicants will be interviewed.

Ideal If: you enjoy fashion, clothing and textiles and are willing to be challenged.  This course is exciting, highly practical and ideal if you intend to go to university or take up a career in the fashion and textiles industry.

You'll need: four or more GCSEs at grade C or above, including English and mathematics.

You'll learn: across the core disciplines of art and design practice, including: ideas and concepts, production techniques, fashion marketing, textile experimentation, surface pattern design and visual communication.

Expect: lots of variety when completing your written assignments and practical projects.

You'll love: being encouraged to independently research, design and develop a range of 2D and 3D outcomes in the form of garments and other related products.

You'll go onto: further studies at Foundation Diploma or university, or employment in the industry.

In addition, the course offers transferable skills in the form of research, analysis, critical thought, observation and problem-solving. Achieving this qualification will provide direct progression routes to a variety of higher education courses in areas such as  Fashion, Textiles and Clothing.
course.mlo:objective: You will study across the core disciplines of all art and design practice: Drawing, Ideas Generation, Visual Commmunication, Contextual Studies and extensive experimentation with Materials and Techniques. You will also study Illustration, Life Drawing, Fashion, Surface Pattern Design and other disciplines.

course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you wish to build on prior experience in art and design, and develop a specialism which informs your practice and your choice of higher level study. This course can lead to a wide range of university courses, providing you with an environment to cultivate an inquiring approach and develop the ability to practice with increased autonomy.

You'll need: a level 3 qualification, equivalent experience and a portfolio of work.

You'll learn: to explore a wide range of materials, techniques and processes through workshops and studio practice. These will allow you to develop new skills whilst enhancing your understanding of art and design relating to social, cultural and personal themes.

Expect: lots of variety, guest lectures and subject specialist teaching.

You'll love: to have your own dedicated and prupose built studio space with access to ecellent workshops in 3D, ceramics, fashion and textiles, printmaking, animation and film.

You'll go onto: employment or university study such as our Foundation Degree in Contemporary Creative Practice.
course.dc:subject: art, arts, artists, design, graphics, graphic, creative, colour, paiting, drawing, draw,art and design
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: Art and Design EDEXCEL BTEC Foundation Diploma Level 3
course.abstract: Develop your skills for a year before applying to University
course.learningOutcome: The Foundation Diploma qualifies students to progress directly on to Higher Education in a specialist Art or Design subject.  There is currently a very large choice of higher level courses such as HNDs, Foundation Degrees or full Honour Degrees that can lead to a wide range of career opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
During the first term students are introduced to a wide range of materials, techniques and processes through workshops, such as: drawing, mark-making, print making, photography, graphics, mixed media, painting, 3D and textiles.  These workshops allow students to explore new skills whilst developing their understanding of art and design; relating to social, cultural and personal themes.  Students benefit from being taught by specialist lecturers, they are also introduced to various 'tools of the trade' such as Apple Macs.

Contextual Studies underpin all aspects of the course and this is taught through lectures, seminars and gallery visits.  Students also have the opportunity to improve their literacy, I.T. and research skills and are given the support to research and apply through U.C.A.S. to courses in Higher Education establishments.

During the second and third term students develop their own projects and ability to work with an increased autonomy, leading up to the Final Major Project, where students are able to consolidate all that they have learnt so far on the course.  With support from staff, they choose the topic, the materials they wish to use and they decide what they would like to produce for a final exhibition of their work. This exhibition showcases the work from the Final Major Project amongst other course work.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You will need to have a level 3 qualification, equivalent experience or in some circumstances a portfolio of work, as well as enthusiasm, commitment and a desire to further your education in the arts. If you wish to apply, you will be asked to bring along a portfolio of your work, if possible, to an informal interview.  The Foundation Diploma qualifies students to progress directly on to Higher Education in a specialist Art or Design subject.  There is currently a very large choice of higher level courses such as HNDs, Foundation Degrees or full Honour Degrees that can lead to a wide range of career opportunities.

course.dc:description: This is a one year course that will be timetabled over 15 hours a week.

Access courses are designed to prepare students for University level study in their chosen subject. dBs Music offers Access to Music Production and Technology in all three of our Centres; in Cornwall, Plymouth and Bristol. This course will provide you with a solid grounding in a range of music production, technology, composition and performance skills. You will be able to chose a pathway through the course to suit your individual needs and interests.

dBs Music is a specialist music education provider that offers state of the art facilities and expert teachers who are highly experienced within all aspects of the music industry. We pride ourselves on providing the best possible student experience through access to excellent resources and equipment alongside inspirational teaching.

The course is aimed at adult students who have not studied A levels before or wish to change career direction and pursue a role within the music industry. The qualification is classed a full level 3 which gives you the points required for Foundation Degrees, HND's and Ba courses within music and music production.

or to other Univeristy level courses.

Further information is available through each dBs Music Centre. There are also a wide range of music based university courses offered across the country. Some students may wish to go straight into employment within the music industry.

course.dc:description:
HNC Music for Film and Television
UCAS Code: 243W
Institution Code: CORN C78

HND Music for Film and Television
UCAS Code: 24HW
Institution Code: CORN C78

This course is for musicians and music makers who want to develop their creativity, theoretical understanding as well as the practical skills to compose, record and produce music and sound for TV, Film and the wider media industry. This brand new course is taught at dBs Music's premier training centre in Camborne, Cornwall (http://dbsmusic.co.uk/cornwall/). As with all dBs Music centres, students will find industry experienced staff, excellent equipment and a relaxed learning environment.

Modules

Year 1 modules make up the HNC Year 1 and 2 Modules make up the HND.

 Year 1 HNC

  • Aural Perception & the Principles of Musical Sound (20 credits)
  • Research & Analysis of Musical Genre (20 credits)
  • Audio Mastering (20 credits)
  • Sequencing Music and Sound (20 credits)
  • Foley Recording Techniques and Engineering (20 credits)
  • Composing for Film & TV (20 credits)

Year 2 HND

  • Critical Music Listening (20 credits)
  • Work Related Experience Interacting with the Music Industry (20 credits)
  • Major Project (20 credits)
  • Sequencing Techniques for Film & TV Composition (20 credits)
  • Sound Design for Film & TV (20 credits)
  • Audio Postproduction (20 credits)

Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: HND Music for Film and Television
course.abstract: This course is for musicians and music makers who want to develop their creativity and theoretical understanding
course.learningOutcome:
Potentially you can apply to progress on to the second or final year of a number of full degree programmes following successful completion of the HND but this may be at the second year stage or third year. Decisions will be made on an individual basis by application.

Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression. Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm) Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
During this course you will cover the areas of sequencing, audio engineering, audio editing, mixing and production techniques. We will also help you to develop abilities within the other audio production and postproduction areas of sound design, sound effects (SFX), dialog replacement (ADR), Foley and location sound.

From the outset, through formal lectures, practical workshops and assignments, you will be encouraged to combine these skills to create audio relevant to visual images and the media. Upon completion you will be well on the road to realising your ambitions to become a competent and creative audio-media professional.

Alongside the technical and creative work you will be developing your personal and business skills which include event management, online business, budgeting and finance, management, career strategy, project management, PR and marketing and event management.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and mathematics: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

We interview all applicants, part of your interview will be by audition to demonstrate performance skills or your demo/show reel of examples of work: the standard of your portfolio of work, coupled with your experience, enthusiasm and commitment is given consideration.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:description:
Some of the units covered include:

Band Rehearsal and Performance - This unit enables learners to develop, use and refine the skills required to rehearse and perform in a musical ensemble or band.
Songwriting Techniques and Skills - This unit enables learners to develop and use the specialised techniques of a songwriter and to foster the skills needed to bring songs to performance.
Music Composition Techniques - This unit enables learners to use different composition techniques to produce coherent musical compositions.
Studio Recording and Engineering – This unit enables learners to develop theoretical and practical knowledge of studio recording, including factors affecting audio quality, equipment and effective planning of recording sessions.
Computer Music Composition and Production - This unit enables learners to use the music composition, production and audio features made available by modern computers.
Improvisation in Music - This unit enables learners to improvise musically by skills and techniques required in a systematic and sustainable way.
Music in Context - This unit enables learners  to examine the contexts within which high and popular musical culture has evolved and continues to develop.

UCAS Code: 093W
Institution Code: CORN C78

HND Music Performance and Technology
UCAS Code: 039W
Institution Code: CORN C78

Future music industry professionals will require a range of essential creative and personal skills to be successful. Relentless ambition, drive, strong communication skills, entrepreneurial vision coupled with raw talent makes the developing music professional a formidable prospect. As with all dBs Music courses we help you identify and develop these essential ingredients so that you can achieve your goals. So if you're looking to become a performing musician who's not only looking to write and produce music, but also to push the boundaries of live performance then this is the course for you.

Modules

Year 1 modules make up the HNC Year 1 and 2 Modules make up the HND.

 Year 1 HNC

  • Aural Perception & the Principles of Musical Sound (20 credits)
  • Research & Analysis of Musical Genre (20 credits)
  • Band Rehearsal & Performance (20 credits)
  • Songwriting Techniques & Skills (20 credits)
  • Planning & Delivering a Live Music Event (20 credits)
  • Studio Recording & Engineering (20 credits)

 Year 2 HND

  • Critical Music Listening (20 credits)
  • Work Related Experience Interacting with the Music Industry (20 credits)
  • Major Project (20 credits)
  • Computer Music Composition & Production (20 credits)
  • Improvisation in Music (20 credits)
  • Music Performance Studies (20 credits)

course.mlo:objective:
During this programme you will develop your essential skills as a musician and composer through individual practice programmes, group performing, master classes and tutorials. You will also reflect on your current abilities, develop critical awareness of your skills gaps and create a career plan to launch into the music industry. In addition to the fundamentals of music practice you will also:

  • master the technology that supports performance
  • record and produce your own music
  • use technology as an extension of your instrument
  • develop entrepreneurial practices
  • understand the music industry and how you can make a living from it

Alongside the technical and creative work you will be developing your personal and business skills which include, event management, online business, budgeting and finance, management, career strategy, project management and PR and marketing event management.

Taught at dBs Music's premier training centre in Camborne, Cornwall (www.dbsmusic.co.uk/cornwall). As with all dBs Music centres, students will find industry experienced staff, excellent equipment and a relaxed learning environment. Day to day the course is delivered through seminars, workshops, group work, performances, studio work and individual practice sessions. You will develop a routine of professional practice based around your instrument and the skills you need to develop.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required. We interview all applicants, part of your interview will be by audition to demonstrate performance skills or your demo/show reel of examples of work: the standard of your portfolio of work, coupled with your experience, enthusiasm and commitment is given consideration.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:description:
Some of the units covered include:*

Studio Recording and Engineering – This unit aims to enable learners to develop theoretical and practical knowledge of studio recording, including factors affecting audio quality, equipment and effective planning of recording sessions.

Computer Music Composition and Production - The aim of this unit is to enable learners to use the music composition, production and audio features made available by modern computers.

Music Composition Techniques - The aim of this unit is to enable learners to use different composition techniques to produce coherent musical compositions.

Applied Music Production Techniques - The aim is to enable learners to research and recreate accepted and innovative studio production techniques before developing a personal approach to music production.

Audio Mastering and Manufacture - The aim of this unit is to enable learners to apply audio mastering skills by preparing recordings for the manufacturing process.

Planning for Public Performance - Planning and running a public event. The aim of this unit is to enable learners to develop the skills required to research, plan and manage productions for public music performance.

course.mlo:objective:
From the outset, through formal lectures, practical workshops and assignments, you will be encouraged to combine these skills to create quality, contemporary electronic music. Upon completion of the course you will be well on the way to building a career as an electronic music producer and performer.

Over the two years you will cover a range of practical and theoretical subjects such as composition, sequencing, synthesis, sound design, audio editing, mixing and mastering, live sound and performance techniques using a range of traditional DJ and software-based platforms.

In addition to covering essential composition and production techniques, you will explore new and exciting methods of sound creation and manipulation using Native Instruments Reaktor software to develop your own performance tools, synthesizers and signal processors. The course will allow you to study this area in greater depth, mastering your craft and looking at new ways of delivering your music, incorporating the latest computer-based performance technologies.

Alongside the technical and creative work you will be developing your personal and business skills which include, event management, online business, budgeting and finance, management, career strategy, project management, PR and marketing and event management.

This brand new course is taught at dBs Music's premier training centre in Camborne, Cornwall (http://dbsmusic.co.uk/cornwall/). As with all dBs Music centres, students will find industry experienced staff, excellent equipment and a relaxed learning environment.

course.dc:description:
BSc (Hons) Horticulture (Garden and Landscape Design)

Institution code: DUCHY D55

UCAS code: 4RL6

Campus: The Eden Project (subject to Plymouth University site approval)

Entry requirements: 240 UCAS points from AS & A-levels or relevant level 3 qualifications. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and maths.

Duration:  3 years full time, 6 years part time

 

BSc (Hons) Horticulture (Garden and Landscape Design) has been specifically developed to provide industry focussed design capabilities and general high level horticultural knowledge that is applicable all sectors of the UK horticultural industry. The programme of study and student experience are greatly enhanced through the collaboration between Duchy College and the Eden Project. The mixture of resources including Eden's plant collections, growing environments, nursery and new dedicated teaching facilities coupled with the nationally renowned micro-propagation research facility of Duchy College Rosewarne, provide a world class platform from which this exciting and stimulating programme will be delivered.

Learners embarking on this programme will become integrated within Eden Project and, in addition to attending the carefully designed taught modules, will have the opportunity to apply and develop a wide range of practical skills by participating in activities in the tropical and Mediterranean biomes, the outdoor garden and nursery crop production facility. As well as benefiting from working alongside Eden's skilled and specialist horticulturalists learners also undertake a work placement within another commercial enterprise.

The Personal & Employability Skills Development module will help you to develop the skills you will need to find and sustain a career when you graduate. The module will also enable you to develop a pattern of reflective practice that will aid you in your search for a successful career.
course.dc:subject: Horticulture
course.dc:title: BSc (Hons) Horticulture (Garden and Landscape Design)
course.abstract: This programme develops industry focussed design capabilities and general high level horticultural knowledge.

Possible Further Study (subject to availability)

  •  MA in Garden and Landscape Design (various institutions)

Possible Careers

  • Garden Designer
  • Landscape Designer
  • Landscape
  • Planning adviser
  • Municipal parks and gardens manager
  • Estate garden manager
  • Horticultural retail manager
  • Nursery stock producer
  • Specialist propagator
  • Garden historian
course.mlo:objective:
The programme of study is delivered through a mix of lectures, seminars tutorials, laboratory sessions and practical hands on experience and skill development delivered across the facilities at Eden. Learners undertake a piece of novel design research work in the final year to explore industry focussed design issues. Assessment is by a mix of examination and coursework, including public presentations at student delivered symposium and poster presentation of design research findings.

This variety of practical opportunity, scientific exploration and new facilities provide an intellectually stimulating academic environment which introduces learners to new concepts, ideas and opportunities and provides a base from which to build an exciting and rewarding career in horticulture.

The Personal & Employability Skills Development module will help you to develop the skills you will need to find and sustain a career when you graduate. The module will also enable you to develop a pattern of reflective practice that will aid you in your search for a successful career.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
240 UCAS points from AS & A-levels or relevant level 3 qualifications. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and maths.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply (GCSE English and Maths at grade C or above- or equivalent qualification- are required).

All applicants are invited to attend an interview as part of the application process.

If you are unsure of your suitability please call us on 0845 60 50 455 or email enquiries@duchy.ac.uk.

course.dc:description:
BSc (Hons) Horticulture (Plant Science)

Institution code: DUCHY D55

UCAS code: 3W21

Campus: The Eden Project (subject to Plymouth University site approval)

 

BSc (Hons) Horticulture (Plant Science) has been specifically designed to meet clearly identified skills gaps required to support and develop the UK horticultural industry across all commercial sectors. The programme of study and student experience are greatly enhanced through the collaboration between Duchy College and the Eden Project. The mixture of resources including Eden's plant collections, growing environments, nursery and new dedicated teaching facilities coupled with the nationally renowned micro-propagation research facility of Duchy College Rosewarne, provide a world class platform from which this exciting and stimulating programme will be delivered.

Learners embarking on this programme will become integrated within Eden Project and, in addition to attending the carefully designed taught modules, will have the opportunity to apply and develop a wide range of practical skills by participating in activities in the tropical and Mediterranean biomes, the outdoor garden and nursery crop production facility. The programme of study also requires students to undertake project work in the Eden quarantine centre and the micro-propagation laboratory. As well as benefiting from working alongside Eden's skilled and specialist horticulturalists learners also undertake a work placement within another commercial enterprise.

The Personal & Employability Skills Development module will help you to develop the skills you will need to find and sustain a career when you graduate. The module will also enable you to develop a pattern of reflective practice that will aid you in your search for a successful career.
course.dc:subject: Horticulture
course.dc:title: BSc (Hons) Horticulture (Plant Science)
course.abstract: This programme fills nationally identified skill gaps relevant to the fields of horticulture, plant science, and agriculture
course.learningOutcome:
Possible Further Study (subject to availability)

  • Research Masters (Biological Science) at Duchy College
  • MSc/PhD at Plymouth University and other institutions

Possible Careers

  • Horticultural adviser
  • Commercial crop producer (fruit and vegetables)
  • Nursery stock producer
  • Specialist propagator
  • Commercial glasshouse manager
  • Cut flower producer
  • Horticultural produce retail manager
  • Estate garden manager
  • Municipal parks and gardens manager
  • Horticultural research
course.mlo:objective:
The programme of study is delivered through a mix of lectures, seminars tutorials, laboratory sessions and practical hands on experience and skill development delivered across the facilities at Eden. Learners undertake a piece of novel research in the final year and are encouraged to make full use of available facilities (especially the micro-propagation laboratory, quarantine centre, nursery and field laboratory) to explore industry focussed issues. Assessment is by a mix of examination and coursework, including public presentations at student delivered symposium and poster presentation of research findings.

This variety of practical opportunity, scientific exploration and new facilities provide an intellectually stimulating academic environment which introduces learners to new concepts, ideas and opportunities and provides a base from which to build an exciting and rewarding career in horticulture.

The Personal & Employability Skills Development module will help you to develop the skills you will need to find and sustain a career when you graduate. The module will also enable you to develop a pattern of reflective practice that will aid you in your search for a successful career.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
240 UCAS points from AS & A-levels or relevant level 3 qualifications. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and maths. 

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply (GCSE English and Maths at grade C or above- or equivalent qualification- are required).

All applicants are invited to attend an interview as part of the application process.

If you are unsure of your suitability please call us on 0845 60 50 455 or email enquiries@duchy.ac.uk.

course.dc:description: The partnership between Cornwall College and the Eden Project has been developed to enable students to learn in an inspirational environment that provides them with access to one of the finest  visitor attractions in the sector. Cornwall College is one of the largest FE colleges in the UK and has been offering university courses since the late 1960s. Cornwall College Camborne is the largest of the seven sites that Cornwall College have across the county. The growing portfolio of programmes offered has meant that the College attracts more and more students from out of the county as well as ensuring that our local community has a wide range of programmes to choose from. We work very closely with Plymouth University who validate the majority of our programmes making you not only a student at Cornwall College but also a student of Plymouth University bringing you access to more resources and more support. At Cornwall College Camborne we offer degrees in Science, Technology, Tourism, Hospitality, Arts, Media, Music,  Health, Social Care and Business, from HNCs to Foundation Degrees and full Honours Degrees. A key feature of our provision is employability.  Equipping our students with the skills they need to get jobs and progress in their careers is just as important as the specialised academic study. Our links with businesses and our dedicated graduate support service help deliver enterprising, work based study.

UCAS Code: N821
Institution Code: CORN C78

Delivered in partnership with the Eden Project, this course is for those wishing to gain a qualification in Event Management based within a world class visitor attraction.

Who is this course for?

For those aspiring to work in the events sector Eden presents a wealth of opportunity to engage with one of the most successful events organisations in the UK.

The partnership between Cornwall College and the Eden Project has been developed to enable students to learn in an inspirational environment within a  framework of sustainability and ethical tourism. This course also provides invaluable industry updating and continued professional development for those who are currently employed in the events industry.

It looks carefully at the industry ensuring that your knowledge is relevant and meets industry standards. The skills and tools that you will develop during the programme will stay with you throughout your future career and ensure that you contribute to the quality and professionalism of this vibrant industry.

Modular Structure

Year 1:
- Introduction to Conferences & Events (20 credits)
- Principles of Event Design & Themes (20 credits)
- Managing Event Operations (20 credits)
- Marketing (20 credits)
- Financial Management (20 credits)
- Personal & Employability Skills Development (20 credits)

Year 2:
Core:
- Event Planning (20 credits)
- Promotional Events (20 credits)
- Festivals (20 credits)
- Human Resource Management & Employment Law (20 credits)
- Applied Business Research (20 credits)
Optional (choose one):
- Special Study (20 credits)
- Leadership & Entrepreneurship (20 credits)
- Education & Interpretation of Tourism Environments (20 credits)
- Sustainable Tourism Management (20 credits)
- Culture & Heritage Tourism (20 credits)
course.dc:subject: FdA, Eden, Project, Events, Tourism, Tourist, Project Management, Event Organising, Organisor, Organiser, Event Planner, Event Planning,
Catering & Hospitality
course.dc:title: FdA Event Management
course.abstract: This course is for those wishing to gain a qualification in Event Management or aspiring to work in the Events sector
course.learningOutcome: The Eden Events Management Foundation Degree will equip you with a qualification from an internationally recognized visitor experience organisation that will open doors across the sector.
course.mlo:objective: This foundation degree will equip you with professional leadership and business management skills, combined with specialist knowledge of the event management industry. Our team of lecturers is composed of industry professionals who operate successful events management businesses alongside their lecturing. You will be working alongside the Eden staff in organising a range of events, conferences, weddings, gigs and performances both within Eden itself and in wider venues across Cornwall. During your two years you will gain invaluable insight into current thinking and practice within the sector as well as the chance to work in partnership with these professionals. The added value of the Eden experience coupled with the way in which we deliver this programme means on completing you will be a sought after professional who is equipped to organise all types of events such as cultural festivals, surf and sports competitions,  corporate trade shows, conventions, fundraisers and awards.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A levels (at least 80 points must be at A2 level) or relevant level 3 qualification, ie BTEC National Diploma/ Extended Diploma – PPP grades required. Access to HE diploma – 45 credits at level3. Plus GCSEs at Grade C or above in English Language and Maths; alternatives at level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt call 08452232567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk
