course.dc:description:
We welcome visits from prospective students. It is hard to know if a course is right for you without actually meeting the tutors and current students, and seeing the work that is produced.....so give us a call and come and see for yourself!

If you have any questions about the Foundation Degree in Contemporary Creative Practice at Cornwall College please do not hesitate to contact:

 

Course Manager – Jamie Hanson

01209 617 654

jamie.hanson@cornwall.ac.uk

UCAS Code: W290
Institution Code: CORN C78

The Foundation Degree in Contemporary Creative Practice, brings together our Higher Education expertise in Graphic Design, Animation, Fine Art, Ceramics, Textiles, Photography and Furniture Design, into a new and vibrant interdisciplinary course. The course aims to provide an invigorating blend of traditional, contemporary and innovative approaches to learning, and is unique to Cornwall and the South West.  What is a foundation degree? Foundation degrees are designed with employers and combine work-related and academic elements. This makes sure that the skills and knowledge that you gain during the course are relevant to your future employment.

Modules

Year 1

  • Visual Language & Research (20 credits)
  • Materials & Processes 1 (20 credits)
  • Materials & Processes 2 (20 credits)
  • Ideas at Work (20 credits)
  • Extramural Project (20 credits)
  • Personal & Employability Skills Developments (20 credits)

Year 2

  • Evaluation (20 credits)
  • Practice in Context (20 credits)
  • Consolidation (20 credits)
  • Professional Identity (30 credits)
  • Negotiated Project (30 credits)
course.dc:subject: Graphic Design Animation Fine Art Ceramics Textiles Furniture Design interdisciplinary creative practice art and design design art foundation degree foundation degree Contemporary Creative Practice
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: FdA Contemporary Creative Practice
course.abstract: The Foundation Degree in Contemporary Creative Practice, brings together our Higher Education expertise in Graphic Design
course.learningOutcome:
As a graduate from this programme you will be self-motivated, questioning and knowledgeable, and be able to see yourself as a positive agent of change in the current art and design landscape. You will also be able to progress onto the BA (Hons) Contemporary Creative Practice final year at Cornwall College Camborne.

 Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression. Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm) Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
Today's artists and designers have to be highly adaptable individuals, constantly moving between different methods of work. The programme responds to the professional reality of the contemporary creative industry, preparing you to respond imaginatively within a range of professional situations.

You will have the opportunity to gain experience in collaboration, communication, creative enterprise, design, digital media, image making, installation, animation, materials innovation, textiles, ceramics, metals, new technologies, furniture making, model-making, mark making, plastics, print, professional practice, public art, and film. To enrich the studio experience and enable you to develop the necessary skills and expertise for a successful future, the programme also includes critical studies, enterprise studies, professional practice, computer applications and workshop options.

Students on the course will form communities of practice, these will be formed across tutor-groups and will be inter-disciplinary, enquiry driven and student-led. You will be encouraged to take collective responsibility and actively work towards peer learning.

You will also benefit from the Sustainable Practice and Creative Enterprise (SPaCE) initiative. SPaCE ensures you receive appropriate work-based learning and through partners and external agencies you will be advised and set projects and live briefs to work on, either individually or collaboratively. SPaCE gives opportunities to collaborate and try out ideas within in a supportive environment whilst mirroring the common project-based work structure used in creative industries.

Please note that you will be required to pay £50 per year towards materials costs. For this contribution you will receive an allocation of materials for the introductory weeks of each module. You will be expected to buy your own materials for the rest of the module, and for any larger projects which you undertake. On average you would expect to spend between £50 and £100 in Year 1 and between £100 and £150 in Year 2.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 points must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3, or an equivalent art or design based qualification. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and mathematics: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

You are expected to attend an interview where possible and should bring a portfolio of your work: trial pieces and evidence of idea generation are more important at this stage than finished pieces. If you are unable to attend personally then sending your portfolio and additional written material by email is acceptable.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:description:
Institution Code: CORN C78

Delivered in partnership with the Eden Project, FdA Contemporary Storytelling and Performance is a skills based course that provides the knowledge and practical expertise needed for success in the performing arts industry. With the incorporation of Eden's ethos this course focuses on developing performance and storytelling skills within a world class visitor attraction. Eden provides an exciting platform and presents a wealth of opportunity to create, interpret and perform a diverse range of material in response to its connections with ethical tourism and the wider creative arts sector.

Who is this course for?

This is a highly practical course which will demand much from you both physically and psychologically. We intend to promote thinking, engaged actors who have an understanding of the context in which they are working and who have developed the skills and knowledge necessary to both have something to say and the means to give expression to that intention. 'If you believe: There should be a place that explores what a great future might look like, That celebrates life and puts champagne in the veins, That's all about education with Mud Between Your Toes, That is a place where you can hold conversations that might just go somewhere, Where research is experience to be shared with everyone, And is for all those who think the future belongs to us all, .....Then welcome to the FdA Contemporary Storytelling and Performance at the Eden Project, home of the Eden Trust.'
course.dc:subject: Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: Fda Contemporary Storytelling and Performance (Subject to Approval)
course.abstract: A skills based course that provides the knowledge and practical expertise needed for success in the performing arts industry.
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the two years needed to gain the FdA you should have developed the skills and qualifications necessary to begin a career within the performing arts and storytelling. Successful FdA students can choose to continue their studies on the final year of an honours programme. Key to your progression will be your personal professional development plan, which you will begin at the start of your course.
course.mlo:objective:
FdA Contemporary Storytelling and Performanceis a skills based course that provides practical expertise needed for a career in sustainability interpretation, storytelling and performance. It is based on the idea of developing performers who can help audiences to reconnect with the natural world. At the core is the skills training in performance, movement, character development, voice, research, analysis, reflection and evaluation which will enable you to enhance your role as a storyteller and performer. In addition, the course will also look at how to make performance and storytelling your professional life.

Under the guidance of your tutors and industry specialists you will gain access to one of the finest visitor attractions in the sector and have the opportunity to examine a range of approaches and techniques within the genre of storytelling, devising, interpretation and performance. Based at the Eden Project, you will establish exciting links with creative partners and encompass diverse issues and projects to explore through workshop, rehearsal and performance. With Eden's inspirational natural landscape as a stimulus and platform for the birth of ideas and the engagement of various audiences through performance, both your experience and the potential for innovation will be optimal. 

This is a highly practical course that will demand much from you both physically and psychologically. We promote thinking, engaged actors who have an understanding of the context in which they are working and who have developed the skills and knowledge necessary to both have something to say and the means to give expression to that intention.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A levels (at least 80 points must be at A2 level) or relevant level 3 qualification, ie BTEC National Diploma/ Extended Diploma - PPP grades required. Access to HE diploma - 45 credits at level3. Plus GCSEs at Grade C or above in English Language and Maths; alternatives at level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt call 08452232567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk

course.dc:description:
UCAS Code: D403

Institution Code: DUCHY D55

Campus: The Eden Project.

FdSc Horticulture has been specifically designed to meet clearly identified skills gaps required to support and develop the UK horticultural industry across all commercial sectors. The programme of study allows students to explore aspects of horticultural science, commercial horticulture and garden and landscape design. The study programme and student experience are greatly enhanced through the collaboration between Duchy College and the Eden Project. The mixture of resources including Eden's plant collections, growing environments, nursery and new dedicated teaching facilities coupled with the nationally renowned micro-propagation research facility of Duchy College Rosewarne, provide a world class platform from which this exciting and stimulating programme will be delivered.

Learners embarking on this programme will become integrated within Eden Project and, in addition to attending the carefully designed taught modules, will have the opportunity to apply and develop a wide range of practical skills by participating in activities in the tropical and Mediterranean biomes, the outdoor garden and nursery crop production facility. As well as benefiting from working alongside Eden's skilled and specialist horticulturalists learners also undertake a work placement within another commercial enterprise.

Modules:

Year 1

  • Personal & Employability Skills Development
  • Research Skills
  • Introduction to Soil Science and Plant Nutrition
  • Introduction to Botany
  • Plant Use in the Landscape
  • Horticulture in Practice 1 (including work placement)

Options:

  • Garden and Landscape Design 1: Foundation- Space, Place and User
  • Classification and Taxonomy

Year 2

  • Research Project
  • Plant Growth and Development
  • Plant Ecology
  • Horticulture in Practice 2 (including work placement)

Options

  • Garden and Landscape Design 2: Planning and People
  • Garden Landscape Histories: Theories and Contexts
  • Plant Pathology
  • Ethnobotany

Modules subject to availability

The programme of study is delivered through a mix of lectures, seminars tutorials, laboratory sessions and practical hands on experience and skill development delivered across the facilities at Eden. Learners undertake a piece of novel research in the final year and are encouraged to make full use of available facilities to explore industry focussed issues. Assessment is by a mix of examination and coursework.

This variety of practical opportunity, scientific exploration and new facilities provide an intellectually stimulating academic environment which introduces learners to new concepts, ideas and opportunities and provides a base from which to build an exciting and rewarding career in horticulture.

The Personal & Employability Skills Development module will help you to develop the skills you will need to find and sustain a career when you graduate. The module will also enable you to develop a pattern of reflective practice that will aid you in your search for a successful career.

course.dc:description:
This course is designed to give you a comprehensive understanding of the techniques and skills needed by the games industry to get you that job or to go on and study a second year. Communications between the games/animation industry and this course are extremely important. Developments in the industry and knowledge gained by staff in their own practice are passed down to the students to inform theirs. Work experience is also a very important part of the study programme and students should expect to be involved in competitions and live briefs. Making you employable is our goal!

Units studied include:

Computer Games Studies and research

Pre Production Design and Computer Game Concept Art

2D Digital Graphics and Texturing for Computer Games

3D Modeling and Animation for Computer Games

Animation Principles

3D Computer Games Engines and Asset Creation

If you have any questions about the HNC Games Design for Industry at Cornwall College please do not hesitate to contact Course Manager – Stephen Howard 01209 617 649 stephen.howard@cornwall.ac.uk

Want to be involved in one of the fastest growing, dynamic and entrepreneurial sectors in the creative industries? Ever played a game and thought you could do a better job of creating the 3D models/animations?

The HNC Games Design for Industry is a skills based course that provides the practical expertise needed for jobs in Games Design, whether you want to be an animator, modeller or developer. It is a challenging, fun programme focusing on developing your core artistic and technical skills. You will get the chance to not only play games but more importantly build them!   

This is aone-year full-time course with a slant towards the creation of game content, 3D animation and assets. The course was developed with input from leading industry professionals to ensure that your experience is realistic and relevant.

UCAS Code: 02PI
Institution Code: CORN C78

Want to be involved in one of the fastest growing, dynamic and entrepreneurial sectors in the creative industries? Ever played a game and thought you could do a better job of creating the 3D models or animations? Then this course is for you.

This is a skills-based course that provides the practical expertise needed for jobs in games design, whether you want to be an animator, modeller, developer or games tester. It is a challenging, fun programme focusing on developing your core artistic and technical skills which are in high demand within the games design and animation industries. You will get the chance to not only play games but more importantly build them!

The course has a slant towards the creation of game content, 3D animation and assets and was developed with input from leading industry professionals to ensure that your experience is realistic and relevant.

Modules

  • Computer Games Studies & Research (20 credits)
  • Pre-production Design & Computer Game Concept Art (20 credits)
  • 2D Digital Graphics & Texturing for Computer Games (20 credits)
  • 3D Modelling & Animation for Computer Games (20 credits)
  • Animation Principles (20 credits)
  • 3D Computer Games Engines & Asset Creation (20 credits)
course.dc:subject: HND, games, design, animation, game, game design, augmented reality, game design, games for industry
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: HNC Games Design for Industry
course.abstract: Want to be involved in one of the fastest growing, dynamic and entrepreneurial sectors in the creative industries?
course.mlo:assessment: Assessment
course.learningOutcome:
On successful completion of the two years' study needed to gain the HND you should have developed the skills and qualifications necessary to begin a career within the games sector or other similar, creative or technical industries. You may even want to be a freelancer. Alternatively you could choose to continue your studies for one more year to top up to an honours degree.

Potential careers could include 3D artist, character designer, animator, games tester, game developer or programmer, game content creator, technical artist, facial animator or rigger, motion editor, visual effects artists, 3D modeller or texturer, cinematic animator, environment artist, level designer, architectural visualiser and many more!

This course is designed to give you a comprehensive understanding of the techniques and skills needed by the games industry to get you that job or to go on and study a third year. Communications between the games and animation industry and this course are extremely important. Developments in the industry and knowledge gained by staff in their own practice are passed down to the students to inform theirs.

Work experience is also a very important part of the study programme and students should expect to be involved in competitions and live briefs. Making you employable is our goal!

Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression. Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm) Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
From the outset, through lectures, workshops, masterclasses and industry-based assignments, you will be encouraged to explore the numerous aspects of games design and 3D animation. You will gain an understanding of games development, 3D modelling and animation, gameplay, motion capture, texturing, narrative, Ludology, concept artwork, together with an overview of the more technical and creative aspects of the games design pipeline.

Practical skills form the basis of the course as well as problem solving: with a strong focus on 3D modelling and animation, 3D character design, rigging and skinning, game art, low and high poly modelling, 3D organic modelling, motion capture and drawing.

You will concentrate mainly on the production of game related assets and 3D animation for games: while developing professional skills in level design, concept development, character and environment modelling, advanced digital animation, project management and entrepreneurship. You will learn traditional core skills alongside industry standard practice in modelling, workflow, advanced lighting, texturing and mapping. This will be encouraged by the use of real time engines to demonstrate your work within a gaming context (Unreal UDK).

As in industry, you'll use your skills collaboratively. You'll create game content in teams as well as individually. You will be encouraged to work creatively and professionally to design and communicate concepts through visuals, prototypes, 3D and 2D game assets, game design documents and presentations.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points. You must have a keen interest in gaming and have a creative imagination. All applicants will be invited for interview.

Due to the highly practical and technical nature of the course either a practical portfolio or show reel, or evidence of practical experience, including a professional or academic reference will be requested at interview.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

presentation.dc:title: HNC Games Design for Industry
presentation.mlo:assessment: Assessment

course.dc:description:
Campus: The Eden Project (subject to Plymouth University site approval)

This programme is designed for those with an emerging passion for garden and landscape design. It will enable you to pursue a career within this creative industry and will also appeal to those who wish to gain a deeper understanding of garden and landscape design for more holistic reasons. This HNC enables you to integrate art and design with core knowledge of horticulture, earth sciences and landscape technology. Innovative and imaginative design practice is encouraged from day one.

The programme of study and student experience are greatly enhanced through the collaboration between Duchy College and the Eden Project. The mixture of resources including Eden's plant collections, growing environments, nursery and new dedicated teaching facilities coupled with the nationally renowned micro-propagation research facility of Duchy College Rosewarne, provide a world class platform from which this exciting and stimulating programme will be delivered.

The programme will develop your knowledge and skills, to meet the diverse and different aspects of art and science that garden design encompasses. If you are looking for a rewarding career where you can have significant influence on the environment and the quality of people's lives then this programme is for you.

Core Modules

CORR135 Horticultural Science (20 Credits)

CORR136 Design Communication: Tools and Techniques (20 Credits)

CORR137 Practical Horticulture for Designers (20 Credits)

CORR138 Design Foundations - Garden & Landscape (20 Credits)

CORR139 Garden & Landscape Design 1: Foundations - Space, Place and User (20 Credits)

FHOR105 Plant Use in Design (20 Credits)

CORC1013 Personal and Employability Skills Development (20 Credits)
course.dc:subject: HNC, garden, garden design, lanscaper, landscape designing, horticulture, floristry, florist, flowers, plants, planting
Horticulture
course.dc:title: HNC Garden and Landscape Design
course.abstract: This programme is designed for those with an emerging passion for garden and landscape design.
course.learningOutcome:
The Higher National Certificate  will be awarded to a student who has successfully completed 120 credits at Level four.  

As a HNC graduate you will have a wide choice of career opportunities throughout the private and public sectors, both in the United Kingdom and abroad.  Plymouth University, Cornwall College and Duchy College students enjoy a good record for the employability of their graduates but it will be up to you to make the effort and find a job. You will need to start thinking about your career and planning early on in your course.

By studying a HND/C course, you have a range of graduate opportunities within industrial and commercial organisations where a broad-based and work-related education is desirable. You may not, however, want to go straight into employment after your studies at the college are over. One option is to continue studying, probably by progressing onto an Honours Degree. Another is to gain a professional qualification.

Please remember that the tutors delivering the HND/C in Garden & Landscape Design have much relevant industrial and career experience between them so do not be afraid to ask for advice about career opportunities and direction. Rosewarne is unique in that it has a working commercial and nursery stock unit. Again staff involved in these units can provide valuable information regarding career opportunities.

As a qualified horticulturist you may have the choice of employment in the following areas, when combined with the correct work experience:-

  • Garden Designer
  • Landscape Designer
  • Landscape Technician
  • Landscaper in Landscape Construction
  • Municipal (Parks/Local Authority)
  • Education
  • Therapy
  • Sporting Venues (Golf/Football/Cricket etc)

Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression. 

Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm) 

Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
Garden design is a rich and diverse subject. This programme aims to integrate the creativity of art and design with core knowledge of horticulture, earth sciences and landscape technology.

Sustainability and environmental enrichment are key features of the programme. This includes working within our designated garden design studio where you will have the opportunity to develop your design skills to a professional standard.

You will also have an opportunity to research the history of gardens and landscapes, evaluate contemporary issues in garden design and build up your plant knowledge: an essential element of garden design.

Work-based and work-related learning is integral to the programme, giving you up-to-date knowledge and skills to enhance your employability within the garden design industry. The programme will make use of the wide and extensive links the College has with The Great Gardens of Cornwall consortium you will have the opportunity to gain actively managed work experience whilst studying.

Based at the Eden Project, the HNC is run over three days per week allowing you to gain part-time employment within the industry, this helps towards a greater understanding of the sector as well as helping your finances. During a typical day you can expect a mix of formal lectures, practicals, visits, guest speakers and individual study time.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 points must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3.  Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and mathematics: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:description: Although the programme is primarily based at Duchy College Rosewarne, it will include a number of visits and a study tour. Guest Lecturers and visiting speakers are also an integral part of the programme.

Campus: The Eden Project (subject to Plymouth University site approval)

The course is designed for individuals with a passion for garden design and management of the Landscape. The course has a strong basis in developing individuals's practical and transferrable skills that are so important within professional practise.

The programme of study and student experience are greatly enhanced through the collaboration between Duchy College and the Eden Project. The mixture of resources including Eden's plant collections, growing environments, nursery and new dedicated teaching facilities coupled with the nationally renowned micro-propagation research facility of Duchy College Rosewarne, provide a world class platform from which this exciting and stimulating programme will be delivered.

As well as the outstanding on site resources and facilities the campus is located in the heart of perhaps one of the richest and most exceptional collections of managed gardens and landscapes in the world.

If you are looking for a career where you can have an influence on the Environment in which you live by having the design      skills, plant knowledge and related experience then this programme is for you.

If you already have a Horticulture, Landscape or plants background then this programme can build on this experience and provide you with a qualification that is nationally recognised, opening new doors of opportunity.

If you wish to study in one of the most beautiful counties of the UK with the most extensive range of plants found growing in the UK then this programme is for you.

UCAS Code: 003K
Institution Code: DUCHY D55

This programme is designed for those with an emerging passion for garden and landscape design. It will enable you to pursue a career within this creative industry and will also appeal to those who wish to gain a deeper understanding of garden and landscape design for more holistic reasons.
 
This HND enables you to integrate art and design with core knowledge of horticulture, earth sciences and landscape technology. Innovative and imaginative design practice is encouraged from day one. The programme will develop your knowledge and skills, to meet the diverse and different aspects of art and science that garden design encompasses. 
 
If you are looking for a rewarding career where you can have significant influence on the environment and the quality of people's lives then this programme is for you.

Modules

Year 1

  • Garden & Landscape Design 1: Foundation - Space, Place & User (20 credits)
  • Plant Use in Design (20 credits)
  • Horticultural Science (20 credits)
  • Design Communication: Tools & Techniques (20 credits)
  • Practical Horticulture for Designers (10 credits)
  • Design Foundations: Garden & Landscape (10 credits)
  • Personal & Employability Skills Development (20 credits)

Year 2

  • Garden & Landscape Design 2: Practice - Planning & People (20 credits)
  • Contemporary Issues in Garden & Landscape Design (20 credits)
  • Gardens & Landscape History (20 credits)
  • Professional Identity (30 credits)
  • Negotiated Project (30 credits)

course.dc:title: HND Garden and Landscape Design
course.abstract: This programme is designed for those with an emerging passion for garden and landscape design
course.learningOutcome:
This course equips graduates to pursue a career within the garden design and managed landscapes industry. On successful completion possible careers could include: 

  • Garden and landscape designer
  • Landscape technician
  • Landscape architectural designer
  • Design and horticultural consultant
  • CAD technician
  • Horticultural therapist
  • Municipal gardener
  • Botanical or estate gardener

 You may also wish to continue your studies for a further year to achieve an honours degree.
course.mlo:objective:
Garden design is a rich and diverse subject. This programme aims to integrate the creativity of art and design with core knowledge of horticulture, earth sciences and landscape technology.

Sustainability and environmental enrichment are key features of the programme. This includes working within our designated garden design studio where you will have the opportunity to develop your design skills to a professional standard.

You will also have an opportunity to research the history of gardens and landscapes, evaluate contemporary issues in garden design and build up your plant knowledge: an essential element of garden design.

Work-based and work-related learning is integral to the programme, giving you up-to-date knowledge and skills to enhance your employability within the garden design industry. The programme will make use of the wide and extensive links the College has with The Great Gardens of Cornwall consortium you will have the opportunity to gain actively managed work experience whilst studying.

Based at the Eden Project, the HND is run over three days per week allowing you to gain part-time employment within the industry, this helps towards a greater understanding of the sector as well as helping your finances. During a typical day you can expect a mix of formal lectures, practicals, visits, guest speakers and individual study time.

120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 points must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required. course.dc:description:
This course is designed to give you a comprehensive understanding of the techniques and skills needed by the games industry to get you that job or to go on and study a third year. Communications between the games/animation industry and this course are extremely important. Developments in the industry and knowledge gained by staff in their own practice are passed down to the students to inform theirs. Work experience is also a very important part of the study programme and students should expect to be involved in competitions and live briefs. Making you employable is our goal!

Units studied include:

  • 3D Modelling and Animation for Computer Games
  • 3D Computer Games Engines and Asset Creation
  • 2D Digital Graphics and Texturing for Computer Games
  • 3D Cut Sequence Design and Digital Audio for Computer Games
  • Level Design and Production for Computer Games
  • 3D Character Animation and Motion Capture for Computer Games
  • Animation Principles
  • Professional Practice
  • Computer Games Studies and Research
  • Pre-Production Design and Computer Game Concept Art
  • Subject Specialism Project
  • Games Design and Development Project

If you have any questions about the HND Games Design for Industry at Cornwall College please do not hesitate to contact Course Manager – Stephen Howard 01209 617 649 stephen.howard@cornwall.ac.uk

HNC Games Design for Industry
UCAS Code: 02PI
Institution Code: CORN C78

Want to be involved in one of the fastest growing, dynamic and entrepreneurial sectors in the creative industries? Ever played a game and thought you could do a better job of creating the 3D models/animations?

HND Games Design for Industry is a skills based course that provides the practical expertise needed for jobs in Games Design, whether you want to be an animator, modeller or developer. It is a challenging, fun programme focusing on developing your core artistic and technical skills. You will get the chance to not only play games but more importantly build them!   

This is a two-year full-time course with a slant towards the creation of game content, 3D animation and assets. The course was developed with input from leading industry professionals to ensure that your experience is realistic and relevant.

Modules

Year 1 HNC

  • Computer Games Studies & Research (20 credits)
  • Pre-production Design & Computer Game Concept Art (20 credits)
  • 2D Digital Graphics & Texturing for Computer Games (20 credits)
  • 3D Modelling & Animation for Computer Games (20 credits)
  • Animation Principles (20 credits)
  • 3D Computer Games Engines & Asset Creation (20 credits)

Year 2 HND

  • Subject Specialism Project (20 credits)
  • 3D Cut Sequence Design & Digital Audio for Games (20 credits)
  • 3D Character Animation & Motion Capture for Computer Games (20 credits)
  • Level Design & Production for Computer Games (20 credits)
  • Professional Practice (20 credits)
  • Games Design & Development Project (20 credits)
course.dc:subject: HND, games, design, animation, game, game design, augmented reality,
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: HND Games Design for Industry
course.abstract: Ever played a game and thought you could do a better job of creating the 3D models and animations?
course.learningOutcome:
At the end of the two year course you should have developed the skills and qualifications necessary to begin a career within the games sector or other similar, creative or technical industries. You may even want to be a freelancer. Alternatively, successful students can choose to continue their studies on the final year of the BA (Hons) in Digital Media and Animation at the University of Plymouth. Key to your progression will be your personal professional development plan, which you will begin at the start of your course. 

Potential careers could include: 3D Artist, Character Designer/Animator, Game Developer/Programmer, Game Content Creator, Technical Artist, Animator, Facial Animator/Rigger, Motion Editor, Visual Effects Artists, 3D Modeller/Texturer, Cinematic Animator, Environment Artist, Level Designer, Architectural visualisation and many more!
course.mlo:objective:
From the outset, through lectures, workshops, master-classes and industry based assignments, you will be encouraged to explore the numerous aspects of games design and 3D animation. Students will gain an understanding of games development, 3D modelling and animation, gameplay, motion capture, texturing, narrative, Ludology, concept artwork, together with an overview of the more technical and creative aspects of the games design pipeline. Practical skills form the basis of the course as well as problem solving - with a strong focus on 3D modelling and animation; 3D character design, rigging and skinning, game art, low and high poly modelling, 3D organic modelling, motion capture and drawing.

It is a HND concentrating mainly on the production of game related assets and 3D animation for games, while developing professional skills in level design, concept development, character and environment modelling, advanced digital animation, project management and entrepreneurship. You will learn traditional core skills alongside industry standard practice in modelling, workflow, advanced lighting, texturing and mapping. This will be encouraged by the use of real time engines to demonstrate your work within a gaming context (Unreal UDK).

As in industry, you'll use your skills collaboratively. You'll create game content in teams as well as individually. You will be encouraged to work creatively and professionally to design and communicate concepts through visuals, prototypes, 3D/2D game assets, game design documents and presentations.

The HND is delivered in our newly equipped Animation Studio with access to our own render farm. Industry based software will be used such as Autodesk (3D Studio Max, Maya and Mudbox etc), the full Adobe Master collection, UDK and others. You will have access to excellent sound labs, video cameras, motion capture equipment and blue/green screens etc.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
You must have a keen interest in gaming and have a creative imagination.

120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3. Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and mathematics: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

Due to the highly practical and technical nature of the course either a practical portfolio or show reel, or evidence of practical experience, including a professional or academic reference will be requested at interview.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:description:
Delivered on location at the Eden Project

Bodelva, St Austell, Cornwall, PL24 2SG, UK.

www.edenproject.com

Institution Code: CORN C78

Delivered in partnership with the Eden Project, FdA Contemporary Storytelling and Performance is a skills based course that provides the knowledge and practical expertise needed for success in the performing arts industry. With the incorporation of Eden's ethos this course focuses on developing performance and storytelling skills within a world class visitor attraction. Eden provides an exciting platform and presents a wealth of opportunity to create, interpret and perform a diverse range of material in response to its connections with ethical tourism and the wider creative arts sector.

Who is this course for?

This is a highly practical course which will demand much from you both physically and psychologically. We intend to promote thinking, engaged actors who have an understanding of the context in which they are working and who have developed the skills and knowledge necessary to both have something to say and the means to give expression to that intention. 'If you believe: There should be a place that explores what a great future might look like, That celebrates life and puts champagne in the veins, That's all about education with Mud Between Your Toes, That is a place where you can hold conversations that might just go somewhere, Where research is experience to be shared with everyone, And is for all those who think the future belongs to us all, .....Then welcome to the FdA Contemporary Storytelling and Performance at the Eden Project, home of the Eden Trust.'
Please contact sarah.mccourt@cornwall.ac.uk for more details
course.dc:subject: HND, Eden, Project, theatre, design, theatre design, sets, theatre sets, movies, films, background, green screen
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: HND Small Scale Theatre
course.abstract: This course is for you, if you are looking to carve out a career in the performing arts
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the two years needed to gain the FdA you should have developed the skills and qualifications necessary to begin a career within the performing arts and storytelling. Successful FdA students can choose to continue their studies on the final year of an honours programme. Key to your progression will be your personal professional development plan, which you will begin at the start of your course.
course.mlo:objective:
FdA Contemporary Storytelling and Performanceis a skills based course that provides practical expertise needed for a career in sustainability interpretation, storytelling and performance. It is based on the idea of developing performers who can help audiences to reconnect with the natural world. At the core is the skills training in performance, movement, character development, voice, research, analysis, reflection and evaluation which will enable you to enhance your role as a storyteller and performer. In addition, the course will also look at how to make performance and storytelling your professional life.

Under the guidance of your tutors and industry specialists you will gain access to one of the finest visitor attractions in the sector and have the opportunity to examine a range of approaches and techniques within the genre of storytelling, devising, interpretation and performance. Based at the Eden Project, you will establish exciting links with creative partners and encompass diverse issues and projects to explore through workshop, rehearsal and performance. With Eden's inspirational natural landscape as a stimulus and platform for the birth of ideas and the engagement of various audiences through performance, both your experience and the potential for innovation will be optimal. 

This is a highly practical course that will demand much from you both physically and psychologically. We promote thinking, engaged actors who have an understanding of the context in which they are working and who have developed the skills and knowledge necessary to both have something to say and the means to give expression to that intention.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A levels (at least 80 points must be at A2 level) or relevant level 3 qualification, ie BTEC National Diploma/ Extended Diploma - PPP grades required. Access to HE diploma - 45 credits at level3. Plus GCSEs at Grade C or above in English Language and Maths; alternatives at level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt call 08452232567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk

This course is a module (CFDMD110) from a Skillset accredited FdA Multimedia design course. It is worth 20 credits and is awarded by Plymouth University.

Contact us for more information.
This course is for business owners, managers and designers who wish to explore advertising, branding, editorial and typographic methods to create imagery ready for print or web media.

The course will be delivered through practical sessions. Delegates will have access to online support materials, and a designated tutor for learning support. Delegates will have to undertake an assignment to successfully pass this course.
course.dc:subject: design, web design, design principles, graphic design, business, design, practical design, marketing material, short course, degree level short course, dlsc, effective design
Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Effective Design for Business
course.abstract: Explore advertising, branding, editorial and typographic business methods
course.learningOutcome: There are several flexible progression opportunities for delegates onto other degree level short courses, including: Web design and authoring; Effective marketing and many more. Training at all levels and in a range of subjects is available through Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
You will develop practical techniques including combining type, symbols and images. You will also explore advertising, branding, editorial and typographic methods to create imagery ready for print or web media.

The course covers;

  • The practice and theory of the design process
  • Understanding theories of composition, legibility, colour, influences of society, gender and class
  • Developing practical image making methods and techniques
  • Developing your skills using Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator
  • Project planning
  • Evaluation

The course will be delivered through practical sessions. Delegates will have access to online support materials and a designated tutor for learning support. Delegates will have to undertake an assignment to successfully pass this course.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements for this course.

This course is for business owners, managers and designers to develop an understanding of web design and authoring.

You will develop the skills and techniques to produce interactive web pages that have multimedia content. You will also gain an understanding of HTML and experience of using more sophisticated vector based software. During the course you will use Dreamweaver software along with many different packages.

The course will be delivered through practical sessions. Delegates will have access , to online support materials, and a designated tutor for learning support. Delegates will have to undertake an assignment to successfully pass this course.

Training at all levels and in a range of subjects is available through Cornwall College Business; contact us to discuss your needs.

This course covers:

  • Analysis and implementation of web design
  • Research examples of current web technologies
  • Demonstrate the use of HTML in the production of web pages
  • Use vector & bitmap based software to provide practical interactivity and integrate both to enhance web design
  • Understand the use of JavaScript as a web tool.

Web Design and Authoring is delivered through practical sessions where delegates will have access to online support materials and a designated tutor for learning support. Delegates will have to undertake an assignment to successfully pass this course.

If you have little knowledge of websites and you would like to take control of your web presence then the How to Sell Online course is for you.

This course will help you to:

  • Gain an overview of what you need to know about running a website of your own
  • Create a professional quality website that you can manage and update yourself
  • Free yourself from dependence on your web designer/developer
  • Manage your site from any device with an Internet connection any time anywhere
  • Develop a web design solution that won’t lock you into anything or anyone
  • Get a SEO friendly website drive more traffic to your site
  • Sell products and services simply and effectively - you are in control
course.dc:subject: Understanding E-commerce, Web design, performance boosting, short course, degree level short course, performance boosting, short courses, dlsc
course.dc:title: How to Sell Online
course.learningOutcome: There are several opportunities for progression onto other performance boosting short courses for business, including Web Design & Authoring, Server Side Programming (PHP), Enhance your E-marketing, Effective Marketing and many more. Training at all levels and in a range of subjects is available through Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
At the end of this course you will be able to:

  • Use the Internet as a research tool in relation to web applications
  • Have a basic understanding of web scripting languages (HTML and CSS)
  • Register domain names and install a WordPress content management systems (CMS) via a control panel
  • Install and customise a CMS theme and create and upload bespoke content
  • Customise a CMS using an online editor
  • Install, configure and maintain an ecommerce module
  • Have a basic understanding of ecommerce,  web marketing and search engine optimisation

The course is delivered through lectures, practical workshops and on-line learning. Successful completion of this course will require the delegate to show an understanding of e-commerce concepts, systems development tools and techniques to produce a database driven website.

course.dc:description:
This course is a 20 credit module from a foundation degree, awarded by Plymouth University. The module code is CFDMD230.

Contact us for more information.

This course is for anyone who would like to progress their web development skills specifically to provide media rich content and enhanced interactivity to their websites. It is ideal for individuals or businesses who wish to enhance their web presence, using industry standard hardware and software (Adobe CS5).

Multimedia Web Design and Authoring provides an ideal follow up to Introduction to Web Design and Web Design and Authoring. It is highly recommended that at least one of these courses should be attended before attempting Multimedia Web Design and Authoring, especially if you have no prior experience of Adobe software or web design.
course.dc:subject: Flash animation, sound, webdesign, web design, art, media, games, video editing, scripting, actionscript, streaming, interactivity, multimedia web design, Dreamweaver, Premiere Adobe, Media Encoder, Flash, performance boosting short courses dlsc creative
Information & Communication Technology
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: Multimedia Web Design and Authoring
course.learningOutcome: There are several flexible progression opportunities for delegates onto other degree level short courses, including: Design principles; Effective marketing and many more. Training at all levels and in a range of subjects is available through Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
During this course you will:

  • Gain knowledge and understanding of industry standard software such as Flash, Dreamweaver, Premiere and Adobe Media Encoder to produce web pages with dynamic content
  • Gain an understanding of how to add sound, film and animation to your web pages, as well as an introduction to using Flash to create animations
  • Gain skills and techniques to stream media (video and audio), creating media rich web pages to enhance any business or personal website, whilst supporting the principles of good design practice
  • You will also be introduced to Flash scripting to add enhanced interactivity
course.mlo:prerequisite: Candidates must have a basic to intermediate level of Web Design and Photoshop to enroll on this course.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description:
Want to work in Television, Film, Journalism, Advertising, Radio, Web Design, Game Design or Animation? Then this is the course for you! Not only do you develop practical, technical and theoretical knowledge, but also the bonus is that it is a coursework-based course, meaning no exams!

An Extended Diploma is the equivalent of 3 A-Levels. This course will particularly appeal to those learners who have an interest in studying media in a way that may be reflected within their own lives and experiences.Alongside this course you will study two additional courses. In year one you will undertake a BTEC National Award in Photography and during year two you will undertake a BTEC Certificate in Web Design, Animation and Game Design all of which carry valuable UCAS points, ensuring you get the university place you want, whilst also enhancing your CV with valuable credentials.

The Extended Diploma Media Production course is a full time programme which means you will be in college from 9.00am - 4.30pm four days a week. Learners have one study day where essential equipment is readily available for your use. Every Wednesday afternoon free time is given for enrichment activities. This is a great place to meet people and make friends. Clubs include - Film Club, Drama Club, Student Newspaper, Duke of Edinburgh Award, Driving Lessons, Skateboarding, Cookery, Gym, Swimming, Surfing, Computer Games Club, Paintballing and more.
course.dc:subject: media T.V Film animation Television production Journalism Advertising Radio Web Design Animation, multimedia, editor, writer, journalist, film maker, cameraman, film school
Arts, Media & Performing Arts
course.dc:title: Creative Media Production EDEXCEL BTEC 90-Credit Diploma Level 3
course.abstract: Want to work in Television, Film, Journalism, Advertising, Radio, Web Design, or Animation? Then this media course is for you!
course.learningOutcome:
Successful completion of this course will widen your future career prospects and employment opportunities within the media industry. Past students have gone on to work in TV production and presenting, advertising and marketing, journalism, film production, radio production, public relations and multi-media web design.

The broad and inclusive nature of the Extended Diploma Media Production course has also seen past students move into careers in teaching, counselling and business driven sectors such as commercial advertising sales. There is also the prospect of progressing onto one of many Higher Education courses either here at Cornwall College or further a-field whether it be at Degree or Foundation Degree level.

Former Cornwall College Camborne Extended Diploma Media student views:
"The ED Media course in my view was the best way to prepare for a career in the media, it gave me the knowledge, confidence and ambition to break into one of the most challenging industries around"

Dan Warren (Senior Producer - ITV1), Producer Credits include ITV1, Optimistic Entertainment, Endemol UK, FIVE, Flextech and ITV2
"I really enjoyed studying the BTEC Media Production course, and in particular the variety of disciplines that were touched upon and the practical nature of each"

Daniel Norris (Producer - American Idol currently living in LA), credits include ITV1 Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, SKY1 Brainiac Science Abuse, ITV1 X Factor, ITV1 Britain's Got Talent
"Being a student on the ED Media course at Cornwall College Camborne has without doubt been the best two years of my life. Great tutors, great friends, great times.", Scott Hayley, Now studying Radio Production and Sport Development Ba at the University of Chester
course.mlo:objective:
The Extended Diploma in Media Production offers study in; camera work, digital video and photographic editing, Photography, Adobe Photoshop, scriptwriting, production management, film analysis, animation, web design, music video production, 3D design, After Effects, commercial production, journalism and lots more including our two week intensive nationally recognised film making machine, Film School.

The additional qualifications you will undertake in Photography, Animation, Web Design and Game Design will enhance and expand the platform of skills that you will take into your first job, or university degree. Study in these additional courses will include; producing websites, digital advertisements, special effects, photographic darkroom skills and more.

As media professionals themselves, the course team structure the programme around their learner's interests allowing students to simultaneously look at the larger industry whilst working towards specialising in areas and roles that interest them. This ethos culminates in a Final Major Project in the second year in which the student will create their own media product supported by the course team. Past projects have included short films, television shows, documentaries, photographic exhibitions, fashion and lifestyle magazines, computer games and social action media.

Past students have worked on a variety of video, audio and print projects for real clients including the National Animal Welfare Trust, the NHS, Cornwall and Devon Fire Service, National Stop Smoking service and live broadcast of the Cornish Pirates rugby games and British Professional Surfing Tour to name a few. Professional projects completed on the course have received much acclaim in the local and national press and the College's efforts to give students professional experience have achieved a Beacon 'Highly Commended' Award for the centre in 2008.

In addition, students will have access to a wide range of professional equipment, effectively allowing them to focus on their own personal projects and videos whether it is skate videos, zombie films, review blogs or comedy pieces. The kit includes HD Canon 5 & 6 D cameras, four camera television studio, recording studio,  Green-screen facilities, steadicam rigs and mounts, 12ft extendable camera crane, portable LED lighting kits, broadcast quality cameras,  and a bank of water cameras including the new HD Go Pro Hero 3, all of which is available to our students to hire at no cost!

However, that's not all. The media course pushes students to work in professional environments with working practitioners. During year one, students will embark on a two week intensive film school project hosted by Dogbite film crew at their incredible film studio in Falmouth. Students will create, shoot, edit, pitch and present a complete film product to industry professionals who have included past Oscar Winner Jane Pugh and Ant and Dec's Creative Director Mike Cunliffe alongside Film Armourer Dan Johnson, who has worked with Steven Spielberg and Matt Damon. The second year will see the student group work alongside Journalists and Graphic Designers to produce 'Traffic', the Cornwall College youth lifestyle magazine, that is entirely written by you! Let's not forget our yearly London trip which includes three nights accommodation in a 3* London hotel, a meal in Planet Hollywood, being in a live TV studio audience, a private 3D IMAX screening, trip to the London Film Museum, a London Eye flight, West End show, shopping and much, much more.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
For this course you will need to have four GCSE passes at grade C or above, one of which must be English or Mathematics. We will also accept equivalent qualifications, for example a completed Level 2 Diploma. Mature learners will be considered on an individual basis.
Please enquire if you are at all unsure as to your suitability and we will be happy to discuss the course and its content with you.

course.dc:description:
Access courses are designed as a stepping stone to enable motivated, enthusiastic people to progress on to Higher Education. This access to higher education science diploma course is ideal for those who want to re-train or re-direct their lives into psychology, social science and many other behaviour related university courses.  There is a very high level of academic and personal support throughout the course, which can help if you need to combine study with part-time employment and family commitments.

Help and support

We also support you through the university application process with tutorials. These are designed to offer guidance and support throughout the learning process. We do however recommend checking the entry requirements for your course at your preferred university

course.abstract: Access to Higher Education
course.mlo:assessment: Assessment will take the form of coursework, presentations or in class assessments depending on the unit you are studying.
course.learningOutcome:
Several of our students have continued their studies at Cornwall College, selecting courses from within with our range of foundation degrees. These include programmes at our Newquay, St Austell and Camborne sites, Falmouth Marine School and Duchy College Stoke Climsland and Rosewarne.

For more info on foundation degrees available at Cornwall College, Duchy College and Falmouth Marine School, just click on this link FdSc. Many of our foundation degrees have a third year "top up" to an honours degree.
course.mlo:objective: Attendance at the College is required three days per week for one year. You will study a range of units at level 3 (equivalent to A level). Each unit is worth 3 credits. For successful completion of the access course you will need 60 credits overall. The 60 credits are made up of 45 credits from your main subject areas (psychology and one science) and 15 credits from your core units, which are designed to prepare you for academic study at university level.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
All applicants will be invited to attend an  interview where full course information is given and you will be expected to complete an Initial Assessment

Applicants who do not hold a GCSE in mathematics or English at grade C or above will be expected to gain these qualifications before or alongside their Access studies. The opportunity to achieve these qualifications will be provided.

course.dc:description:
Access courses are designed as a stepping stone to enable motivated, enthusiastic people to progress on to Higher Education. This course is ideal for those who want to re-train or re-direct their lives into Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Mechanical Engineering, Mining Engineering, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Marine Engineering, Aeronautic Engineering, Renewable Energy, Mechatronics, Astrophysics, Robotics, and many other science related university courses.  This course has been designed specifically to meet the requirements of universities, who increasingly demand a substantial physics and mathematics content in order to enable progression onto an engineering, physics or mathematics related degree. There is a very high level of academic and personal support throughout the course, which can help if you need to combine study with part-time employment and family commitments.

Help and support

 

We strive to timetable lectures, wherever possible, between the hours of 9:30am and 3pm to fit in with family commitments.

We also support you through the university application process with tutorials. These are designed to offer guidance and support throughout your course. We do however recommend checking the entry requirements for your course at your preferred university
Attendance at the College is required three days per week for one year. Assessment is principally by assignment, although there are also timed tests and at least one extended piece of coursework.

course.dc:description:
UCAS Code: F9N2
Institution Code: CORN C78

This course is designed as a stand alone, third year, top-up to full BSc Honours and is for anyone over 18 who has a keen interest in environmental science, conservation or habitat management and who wishes to develop a strong base of scientific and transferable knowledge and skills in a degree studies context. It is designed for those who have completed a foundation degree or higher national diploma in a relevant subject. Many are available at Cornwall College.

Modules
Core 
  • Research Methods (20 credits)
  • Project (40 Credits)
  • Geographical Information Systems and Environmental Impact Assessment (20 credits)
Optional (choose two)
  • Environmental Sustainability and Economics (20 credits)
  • Environmental Strategy and Marketing (20 credits)
  • Environmental Investigation (20 credits)
  • Wildlife Crime (20 credits)
course.dc:subject: environment, science, energy, sustainability, geography, geographical, ecology, freshwater ecology, ecotoxicology, pollution, economics, wildlife crime, BSc
Science
course.dc:title: BSc (Hons) Environmental Resource Management
course.abstract: The course is for anyone who has a keen interest in environmental science, conservation or habitat management.
course.learningOutcome:
Upon successful completion of this course many of our graduates have progressed on to teacher training courses and now teach in local schools and colleges. The theoretical and practical training and experience you will gain during this year will provide you with excellent opportunities for employment in conservation, environmental management and other related areas. A number of successful students have gained employment with organisations such as the Environment Agency, South West Water, coast and countryside units, and the local council.

Successful students will also find a number of suitable MSc level progression routes available locally at both Plymouth and Exeter universities. 

Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression.

Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm)

Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
You will have the opportunity to carry out an individual research project in an area of environmental management, ecology, energy management, renewable energy, environmental protection or economic sustainability.

You will also benefit from the opportunity to gain fieldwork experience in Cornwall's unique environment, develop knowledge of environmental legislation and environmental management. You will find Cornwall College Camborne is located in an area of significant urban regeneration and is also in an area that provides many examples of important environmental management issues.

You will be able to take advantage of the College's well established links with individuals and organisations involved in environmental management and with creating a sustainable energy future.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
You must have 240 Credits from an appropriate science foundation degree or HND.

If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

CE:cost.category: Full Time Degree and Top Up
CE:cost.dc:description: For information on fee payment options please contact our Enquiries Team.

You must have been ordinarily resident in the UK or the European Union (EU) or the European Economic Area (EEA) continuously for at least the previous three years on 31st July 2013.

course.dc:description:
UCAS Code: F410
Institution Code: CORN C78

Up for a challenge? Do you have the kind of mind that wants to solve a mystery, to understand why people do what they do? If the answers is 'yes', then this course may be for you. The course allows you to understand the modern forensic techniques used in solving crime and understand criminal behaviour. Using a combination of hands on experience and classroom based learning you will be introduced to the fascinating field of forensic investigation.

Modules

Year 1

Core

  • Forensic Science (20 credits) 
  • Quantitative Methods (20 credits) 
  • Crime Scene Investigation and Management (20 credits) 
  • Forensic Biology (20 credits) 
  • Personal & Employability Skills Development (20 credits) 

 

Optional modules (choose one)

Psychology pathway

  • Introduction to Forensic Psychology: Theory & Practice 1 (20 credits) 

Incident Investigation pathway

  • Forensic Data Capture & Recovery  (20 credits)

Year 2

Core

  • Psychology in the Courtroom (20 credits)
  • Research Design & Methods (20 credits)
  • Law for Forensic Scientist (20 credits)
  • Analytical Chemistry & Instrumentation for Forensic Science (20 credits)

 

Optional modules (choose one)

Psychology pathway

  • Criminal Psychology (20 credits)
  • Forensic Psychology: Theory and Practice 2 (20 credits)

Incident Investigation pathway

  • Crime Investigation Protocols & Procedures (20 credits)
  • Forensic Fire Incident Investigation (20 credits)
course.dc:subject: FdA, Science, Forensics, Criminology, CSI, crime scene investigation, psychology, forensic psychology, investigation, crime scence, crime, law enforcement, biology, criminal, fire incident,
Science
course.dc:title: FdSc Forensic Science
course.abstract: FdSc Forensic Science
course.learningOutcome: This foundation degree equips you with a range of essential skills which support a variety of careers within or outside of the science sector. As well as providing a valuable platform for further study, this foundation degree also provides a route into employment sectors such as crime scene investigation, forensic science laboratory technician, research analyst, law enforcement, the education sector and working with young offenders.
course.mlo:objective:
This programme looks at a variety of topics including law, psychology, biology and maths. Once you are familiar with the different theories, you will then be able to put into practice what you have learnt.

There are two pathways on offer: Psychology and Incident Investigation. This means that you can focus on the area of forensic science that most interests you. You will be based in the science department at the Camborne campus where you will benefit from experienced full-time staff and very well equipped laboratories.

You will be part of a large and vibrant community, but with the benefit of intimate class sizes to ensure an encouraging and productive learning atmosphere. 

Overall, you will be assessed mainly though coursework and assignments. The assignments will be scenario based and the work you carry out will be largely investigative. However you will also have to sit exams, participate in group work and presentations, and also write reports based on your lab and practical work.

The programme is delivered over roughly three consecutive days per week, enabling you to work part-time, or participate in the social activities available on and off campus, around your study time.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
120 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 80 points must be at A2-level, preferably in a science subject) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - PPP Grades required, specific unit grades may be required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3.  Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language, mathematics and a science: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk

The course has been designed with the involvement of employers. Many of whom are prepared to come to the College to give talks to students about their working environment and the qualities that they expect in potential employees.

contact us for more information.

UCAS Code: N210
Institution Code: CORN C78

This business degree course is perfect for anyone considering a business career in a wide range of business sectors, including retail, the professions and the public services. You will develop an understanding of how a business operates and deals with the challenges and opportunities business faces.

Modules

Year 1
  • Business Environment (20 Credits)
  • Marketing (20 Credits)
  • Business Finance (20 credits)
  • Legal Environment (10 Credits)
  • People Development & Leadership (20 Credits)
  • Business Maths and Spreadsheets (10 credits)
  • Personal & Employability Skills Development (PESD) (20 Credits)
Year 2
  • Business Strategy (20 Credits)
  • International Business Strategy (20 Credits)
  • Introduction to HRM & Employment Law (20 Credits)

course.dc:title: BA (Hons) Business Enterprise Management
course.abstract: This Business degree is perfect for anyone considering a business career in a wide range of business sectors.
course.mlo:assessment: Test
course.learningOutcome:
This new business degree course replaces the FdA which in turn replaced the HND in Business at Cornwall College, which was established in September 1991. Over that time approximately 750 people have graduated with the qualification. These people are now employed in a wide range of business occupations, including retail management, marketing, management consultancy, business development management, accountancy, teaching, the police, financial services, hotel management, banking, systems analysis and academic research.

Successful graduates can expect to progress onto a range of further professional qualifications including:

  • CMI Strategic Diploma at Cornwall College Camborne
  • MA Management at Cornwall College Camborne
  • MBA at Plymouth University

The Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression. 

Contact details:

Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9 - 4.00 pm)

Alternatively you can email any questions to kathleen.pope@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective: This is a full-time programme of study, usually delivered over three years two days per week. It will prepare you for entry into employment in a variety of management level roles across a variety of business sectors. The degree focuses on the three pillars of business studies: marketing, finance and management. You can expect to develop knowledge and understanding of leadership, motivation, customer segmentation, market types, profit and costs, financial management and corporate social responsibility.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
180 UCAS points from AS and A-Levels (at least 140 points must be at A2-level) or relevant level 3 qualification i.e. BTEC National Diploma/BTEC Extended Diploma - MMP Grades required. Access to HE Diplomas - 45 credits at level 3.  Plus GCSEs at grade C or above in English language and mathematics: alternatives at Level 2 may be considered.

Mature applicants with relevant experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered individually and are encouraged to apply.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:description: contact us for more information.

This is a top-up degree to convert your HND or FdA in a business related subject to a BA (Hons) Business Enterprise. This course is aimed at those who want to develop a creative solution orientated approach to business. You will have an interest in business improvement techniques, enterprise and value adding.

It is our belief that an enterprise focused degree will enable you to prepare for employment in smaller firms whilst not negating the development of a skills set that is very relevant to modern corporate settings (intrapreneurship). In recent years this type of degree has been successfully developed at other institutions especially in the USA.

Core Modules

  • Business Management (20 Credits)
  • Responsible Enterprise (20 Credits)
  • Enterprise Portfolio (20 Credits)
  • Performance Management (20 Credits)

Optional Modules (two to be chosen)

  • Human Resource Management and Employment Law (20 Credits)
  • Lean for the Whole Enterprise (20 Credits)
  • Strategic Marketing Management (20 Credits)

course.abstract: This a top up degree to convert a relevant HND or Foundation degree in to a BA Hons Business Enterprise
course.learningOutcome:
Relevant job opportunities exist in all sectors of industry, commerce and public service. Graduates from similar courses have entered careers in accounting, marketing, general management, local government, national health and teaching. Other areas include the police force, customs and excise, hotel management, hospitality management and management consultancy. There are also opportunities to take professional qualifications within the college in marketing, law, education, management and accountancy.

Our Careers Service is available to give information, advice and guidance on all aspects of education, training and career progression.

Tel: 01209 616270 Monday, Tuesday and Thursday (9am- 4pm)

Email: careers@cornwall.ac.uk
course.mlo:objective:
Enterprise Portfolio Consultancy Project Responsible Enterprise Human Resource Management & Employment Law Performance Management Strategic Marketing Management.

You will have the opportunity to conduct live consultancy work with local and national companies, to apply theoretical skills to practical situations and to develop your employability skills through enterprise. Your existing skills will be developed through a series of lectures, seminars and problem-based learning opportunities.

The more theoretical aspects of business studies will be contextualised into real world business settings and you will be encouraged to nurture your problem-solving talents. You will be assessed through a combination of reports, presentations, articles, tests and simulations.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
An FdA or equivalent qualification in a business related subject obtained within the last 5 years and successful interview.

Previous learning and experience may be credited. If in doubt, call 0845 22 32 567 or email enquiries@cornwall.ac.uk.

course.dc:title: Effective Marketing
course.learningOutcome: There are several flexible progression opportunities for delegates onto other degree level short courses and marketing qualifications, including Event Management, the Chartered Institute of Marketing's Professional Certificate and many more. Training at all levels and in a range of subjects is available through Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
The course will give you the tools that you need to create a fully costed and effective marketing plan.

  • Understand your markets and customers
  • Carry out market research
  • Understand pricing, promotion, products and place
  • Implement a range of marketing activities from the marketing mix
  • Learn how to use PR effectively to promote your business
  • Gain a clear understanding of how to improve the return on investment with your marketing activities
  • Embrace social media –a guest speaker will help you to understand the different technologies available and how you can incorporate them into your marketing strategy.

Effective Marketing will be delivered through practical sessions, lectures and group discussions, using examples from real local businesses.
