Hair, Beauty & Wellbeing
course.dc:title: Hairdressing Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: hairdressing
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma in Hairdressing, you could progress to senior stylist, salon trainer, manager or own your own salon. Alternatively, you could work on films sets or cruise ships. 

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol on a cutting course in London, a Level 4 Salon Management Apprenticeship or branch out and enrol in the Barbering Apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell and Saltash campus 1 day per week for 18 months, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will build onto your Level 2 Diploma and learn advanced colour, cutting and styling techniques. You will learn about colour correction and promote suitable products to clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Hairdressing
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this advanced apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs and be employed within a salon environment. You must have a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job, as you will be on your feet most of the day.

You need to have completed the Level 2 Hairdressing Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

You must have good interpersonal skills, respect for people who use the service, good verbal and non verbal communication skills and a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Health and Social Care Apprenticeship and supports those working in a variety of roles e.g. senior healthcare support worker, senior healthcare assistant, care officer, care supervisor, senior care worker, supervising care worker, senior support worker, relief team leader, social work assistant, social services officer, community outreach/support worker, family support worker or personal assistant.

course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you may progress to a more senior position e.g. social care worker, care home manager or other supervisory care positions

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol in the FdA Health and Community Studies, FdSc Healthcare and Practice or FdSc Working with Older Persons followed by a BSc (Hons) Health and Social care. Alternatively, you could enrol in nursing or midwifery.
course.mlo:objective:

During this apprenticeship, you will build onto your level 2 diploma and develop advanced skills in the health or social care area. You will have the opportunity to select units to suit your job e.g. care planning, dementia care, supporting people with learning disabilities, pressure area care, infection control and moving and handling.

course.dc:description:
If you are interested in this apprenticeship, contact Cornwall College Business and complete an online apprenticeship form. If you meet the requirements, you will be invited for an interview and be given advice and guidance on how to proceed.

Ideal if: you're working in the plumbing industry and want to start your own business, supervise other plumbers within your current firm, or complete an apprenticeship to the highest level.

You'll need: a relevant level 2 qualification.

You'll learn: how to design complex hot water, cold water, heating and sanitation systems from scratch, and learn how to comply with current Building Regulations.  There are also opportunities to learn about solar thermal hot water or gas utilisation.

Expect: to be assessed with online tests, written assignments, practical assessments and a block week when you will install, commission and handover a fully-pumped, sealed system.

You'll love: completing your full apprenticeship and achieving several industry qualifications such as a Water Regulations ticket along with your NVQ Diploma.

You'll go onto: a successful career as a plumbing and heating engineer, coming back to us regularly to update your skills and learn new technology!

 

You must enjoy working in the construction industry, have good practical and hand skills and be able to follow technical drawings and building plans. No two days are the same; you must enjoy doing a variety of tasks and be good at solving problems.

This course is offered from our Camborne campus, where you will follow the Solar Thermal route, and our Saltash campus, where you will follow the gas route.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, plumbing, engineering, services, plumber, mechanical, water, oil, thermal hot, water, gas, fires, combustio, performance, water regulations, domestic hot water, energy efficiency, building regulations, rain water, harvesting, LPG, building regulations, heat pumps, construction, city & guilds
Apprenticeships
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Plumbing Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Learn on the job and gain an advanced qualification.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Certificate, you are qualified to an advanced level and could work as a plumbing technician or be involved in designing environmentally friendly systems e.g. water management, grey water systems and rain water catchment.

You may be interested in gaining further qualifications through Cornwall College:

  • NICEIC Core Domestiv Gas Safety (CCN1) (if not already achieved)
  • NICEIC Level 3 Solar Thermal Hot Water (if not already achieved)
  • Domestic/Light Commercial Oil Firing System Installation
  • NICEIC Building Regulations Part P Domestic Installer Qualification - Defined Scope Level B
  • LPG - Boats
  • LPG - Leisure Activity Vehicles
  • LPG - Residential Park Homes
  • NICEIC Natural Gas to LPG Gas Changeover Assessment
  • NICEIC Energy Efficiency Building Regulations
  • NICEIC Gas Fires and Heaters
  • NICEIC Gas Cookers
  • Combustion Performance Analysers
  • Heat Pumps Ground and Air Source
  • Rain Water Harvesting to be offered soon

In the future, you may be interested in starting your own business, teaching or working in a management position in a variety of industries e.g. plumbing, oil, water.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne or Saltash campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the work place.

During this apprenticeship you will install complex cold water, hot water, sanitation and heating systems as well as fuel burning appliances such as gas (if based at Saltash campus).  At Camborne campus you will follow the Solar Thermal Hot Water route.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion of your apprenticeship from Saltash, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Water Regulations certificate
  • Unvented Hotwater Supply Commissioning and Servicing
  • NICEIC Core Domestic Gas Safety (CCN1)
  • NICEIC Water Heaters and Wet Central Heating (CENWAT)
  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Mechanical Engineering Services - Plumbing 

Upon successful completion of your apprenticeship from Camborne, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Water Regulations certificate
  • Unvented Hotwater Supply Commissioning and Servicing
  •  Level 3 City and Guilds Solar Thermal Hot Water
  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Mechanical Engineering Services - Plumbing
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed as a plumber. You must to have completed a Level 2 in Plumbing or have the relevant experience.

You must enjoy working in the construction industry, have good practical and hand skills and be able to follow technical drawings and building plans. No two days are the same; you must enjoy doing a variety of tasks and be good at solving problems.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who are semi skilled in craft masonry and want to train on the job to become a fully qualified craft mason.

You must enjoy working in the construction industry and have good practical and hand skills.

This is a follow on course from the Level 2 Trowel Occupations Apprenticeship, and supports those working in a trainee trowel position.
course.dc:subject: trowel occupation, building, construction, plaster, bricklay, render, apprenticeship, brick laying, flooring, builder, design
Construction Trades
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Trowel Occupations Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma, you are a fully qualified craft mason and may progress to a foreman or supervisory level in the future.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in the Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Construction Contracting Operations, Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Site Supervision or FdSc Sustainable Construction. Thereafter you could progress to a BSc (Hons) in Environmental Construction Surveying, Building Surveying or Construction Management.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell or Saltash campus for 1 day per week for 1 year. For practical tests, you will be required to complete a number of 1 week blocks at Cornwall College where you will build chimneys, obtuse angles and arches.

During this apprenticeship you will carry out structural and decorative brickwork, repair and maintain masonry structures and erect complex masonry structures. You will develop good communication skills and learn how to produce quotes for clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Trowel Occupations
  • Level 3 Diploma in Bricklaying (QCF)

The Level 3 Diploma in Bricklaying can also be completed as a standalone course, without going through the apprenticeship program.

The Trowel Occupations course has been adjusted for the South West region where majority of work is in stone, not brick.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within suitable position.  You must have a Level 2 Diploma in Trowel Occupations or have the relevant work experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

Business, Administration & Law
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Warehousing and Distribution Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Certificate in warehousing and distribution, you are qualified to the level of a warehouse supervisor or manager, and may find yourself progressing to a more senior position within your company e.g. management team.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management or leader management apprenticeships. Alternatively you may be interested in completing a Certificate in Logistics and Transport.
course.mlo:objective:
This apprenticeship is work based, so you will receive training on the job for 1 year.

During this apprenticeship, you will build onto your Level 2 Certificate and have the opportunity to select units to suit your job. You will develop advanced skills in distribution, warehousing and storage operations, which may include learning to operate a variety of equipment and machinery e.g. forklift and compact crane.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College Business tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 Certificate in Warehousing and Distribution
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in a suitable position e.g. warehouse supervisor. You must have completed the Level 2 Warehousing and Distribution Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Health and Social Care.

You must have good interpersonal skills, respect for people who use the service, good verbal and non verbal communication skills and a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job.

This apprenticeship supports those working in a variety of roles e.g. healthcare support worker, healthcare assistant, care assistant, personal assistant, relief team worker, night care assistant, support worker, mental health support or outreach worker, re- enablement worker, home care support, substance misuse worker and key workers in residential support or outreach worker.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, health, social care, nursing, family support, care assistant, mental health worker, city & guilds
Health & Social Care
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Health and Social Care Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
On successful completion of Apprenticeship level 2, you can progress onto the nationally recognised Level 3 Advanced Apprenticeship.

Upon successful completion of both the level 2 and level 3, you may progress to a more senior position e.g. senior carer or other supervisory care positions.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further by applying for a HE degree or level 5 Higher Apprenticeship, which could lead onto a care managment position.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at one of the Cornwall College sites - (Camborne, Saltash or St Austell) 1 day a week for 12 weeks; the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace, where you will need to be working up to 30 hours a week.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway and the units to suit your job e.g. infection control, dementia awareness, supporting people with learning disabilities, support for mobility, continence and hygiene care.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors and assessors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 2 Apprenticeship in Health and Social Care (Adults) for England (QCF)
course.mlo:prerequisite: To enrol on the Health & Social Care Apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in Maths and English) and be employed in a suitable position within the health and social care industry. If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Customer Service Advisors on 0800 731 7594.

Apprenticeships

You may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the Level 3 Trowel or Carpentry Apprenticeship.

You must have good practical skills, be able to follow technical drawings and work carefully and methodically. This course supports those working in a trainee boatbuilding position.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeship boatbuilding yacht marine marine negineering boatbuilder surface finishing welding rigging sheet metalwork paint marine surface finishing
Conservation, Zoology and Animal Behaviour
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Marine Surface Finishing Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Certificate, you are semi skilled and qualified to work as a junior marine crafts person. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Certificate by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

Upon successful completion of the advanced apprenticeship, you are a fully qualified marine craftsperson and could work as a boat builder, marine surface finisher or a marine maintenance technician. In the future, you could progress to the level of a supervisor, technical manager, programme manager or programme director within the boatbuilding industry.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in the team leading, people management, carpentry and joinery or engineering apprenticeship through Cornwall College Business. Alternatively you may be interested in the full time FdSc Boat Design and Production course, which is offered at Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select a pathway to suit your job e.g. electrical installation and maintenance, mechanical installation and maintenance, sheet metalwork, manual welding, rigging, surface preparation and yacht painting. You will gain background knowledge

You may prepare and finish a variety of tasks within the project from hand grips and marine engines to repairing hulls of boats and carbon fibre masts; you will develop thorough knowledge in boatbuilding and gain valuable experience.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Marine Engineering
  • Level 2 Certificate in Boatbuilding, Maintenance and Support
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:subject: apprenticeship, body and paint, automative, vehicles, motor vehicles, mechanical
Motor Vehicle
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Vehicle Body and Paint Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you are semi skilled and qualified to work as a junior technician in vehicle repair and paint refinishing operations. Thereafter you can start working towards the nationally recognised Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

In the future, you could work as a body repair technician, body finishing technician, start your own business or teach. You may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, vehicle maintenance and repair or vehicle parts operations apprenticeship.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship, you will have the opportunity to select a pathway that suits your job. You will choose from the following:

  • Body repair - remove, repair, replace and fit non-structural vehicle body panels
  • Paint refinishing - prepare and apply foundation materials to vehicles and fix minor paint defects

Every vehicle will present a new challenge, with no bump and scratch being the same.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 Certificate in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
  • NVQ in Vehicle Body and Paint Operations
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over and ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C level. You must be employed in a suitable trainee position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Marine Engineering Certificate, you are qualified to the level of a junior craftsperson and may progress to a more senior position with more responsibility. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Marine Engineering Diploma, by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.

This apprenticeship could be the foundation in your career and could take you in a variety of directions; in the future you could work as a designer, fitter, operator, project manager or programme director.

course.mlo:objective:

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway and units to suit your job e.g. installation and fitting out of boats, servicing and maintenance of marine engines, principles of marine electrical systems or producing and repairing hulls and decks.

Depending on your workplace, you may have the opportunity to work on variety of boats e.g. ships, tankers, ferry boats, fishing vessels or sporting boats.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 Certificate in Boatbuilding Maintenance and Support

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 2 Certificate in Warehousing and Distribution
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description:
If you are interested in this apprenticeship, contact Cornwall College Business and complete an online apprenticeship form. If you meet the requirements, you will be invited for an interview and be given advice and guidance on how to proceed.

There are no apprenticeship course fees charged for anyone between the ages of 16 and 18.  For those aged 19 and over, fees do apply.

Contact us for more information.

This Advanced Apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and progress from a Level 2 to a Level 3 Apprenticeship in Barbering. You must enjoy working within a salon environment and enjoy working on a one to one basis with clients.
course.dc:subject: barber apprenticeship hair hairdressing hairdresser barbering
Hair & Beauty
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Barbering Apprenticeship Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 3 Diploma in Barbering, you could progress to management level, own your own barber shop or work on film sets.

In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol on a cutting course in London, a Level 4 Salon Management Apprenticeship or branch out and enrol in the Hairdressing Apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the St Austell or Camborne campus one day per week for one year, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will build onto your Level 2 Diploma and perform creative hair cutting and design and creation of a range of facial hair shapes. You will also be involved in hairdressing consultation services and promoting services or products to clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving regular support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Barbering
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this advanced apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over and have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C. You must be employed within a salon environment and have a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job, as you will be on your feet most of the day.

You will need to have completed the Level 2 Barbering Apprenticeship or have the relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:description:
An animal care advanced apprenticeship will often be for those who have already successfully completed a relevant level 2 provision and/or who hold appropriate employment, expertise and responsibilities performed within the workplace.

You must be employed within the sector and display a strong interest in your job role, as well as being able to demonstrate enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed as a recognised professional within industry.

Ideal if: you have already completed a relevant level 2 qualification and you work in or would like to work in the animal management industry.

You'll need: a relevant level 2 qualification or apprenticeship, although prior experience will be considered. You'll also need GCSEs at grade D or above in English and mathematics, or a level 1 functional skills qualification.

You'll learn: to further develop your animal management abilities in animal health, controlling and restraining animals, animal feeding and nutrition, breeding, monitoring and evaluating animal accommodation, and supervisory skills and management.

Expect: to spend one day each week at one of the Duchy College campus sites, and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You'll love: earning money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progress to university study, such as our Foundation Degree in Animal Health and Management.

Animal Management & Veterinary Nursing
course.dc:title: Animal Management Advanced Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised Animal Management qualification.
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your animal care skills and expertise, explore the further career options that become available to you or progress onto higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on the structure outlined on the level 2 apprenticeship provision. This will further develop your animal care abilities in avenues relating to areas such as:

  • Implementing and monitoring animal health, welfare and wellbeing
  • Planning, monitoring and evaluating animal accommodation
  • Controlling and restraining animals
  • Animal health, safety and security
  • Supporting animal diets and feeding regimes
  • Breeding
  • Risk assessment
  • Loading and unloading animals for transport
  • Supervisory skills and management

These advanced apprenticeships are delivered at one of Duchy College's campuses either at Stoke Climsland, Rosewarne or an industry based venue.  You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: Animal care qualifications at level 2 or above will often prove to be of benefit, although they may not always be essential.  Your individual circumstances and experiences are taken into account and our Liaison Officers are pleased to support you and to discuss training avenues to suit your needs.

course.abstract: Land-Based Service Engineering Advanced Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion of the course, you may choose to continue working in the industry using your skills and expertise, explore your career options or progress onto higher education.
course.mlo:objective:
What will I be doing on the course?
You will undertake an enhanced programme of learning that builds on the structure outlined on the level 2 apprenticeship provision.  This will further develop your technical abilities and endorse your knowledge and understanding.

You will undertake the following units:

  • Maintain health and safety in the work environment
  • Establish and meet customers' technical requirements
  • Diagnose faults in tractors and machinery
  • Dismantle, assemble, repair and modify components / land-based machinery
  • Conduct testing of tractors and machinery
  • Co-ordinate work activities
  • Workshop practices
  • Welding processes and joining
  • Functional Skills (where applicable)
  • Emergency first aid (if not gained)
  • Employment rights and responsibilities

These advanced apprenticeships are delivered at Duchy College's Rosewarne campus.
You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.

course.dc:description:

You must be employed within the agriculture sector and display a strong interest in your job role, as well as being able to demonstrate enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed as a recognised professional within industry.

Ideal if: you have already successfully completed a relevant level 2 qualification, or have appropriate employment, expertise and responsibilities.

You'll need: a level 2 agriculture qualification or apprenticeship, although relevant prior experience will be considered. You'll also need GCSEs at grade D or above in English and mathematics, or a level 1 functional skills qualification.

You'll learn: to develop your agricultural abilities and advance your knowledge and understanding of practices relating to livestock and crop production. The course includes: farm visits, visiting speakers and seminars, studying farming systems and farm accounts and records.

Expect to: work with your employer for most of the week, attending college one day per week to cover 50% practical and 50% theory work. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You'll love: the chance to earn money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progress to an Agriculture City & Guilds Extended Diploma, an Agricultural Business Management City & Guilds Diploma Level 4 (work-based) or to university study such as our Foundation Degree in Agriculture.

course.dc:description:
This modern fish frying apprenticeship programme is being taken up by employers across the UK for both new entrants and established employees, young and old workers, and even by the occassional manager.

As well as being paid, you will work towards a nationally recognised qualification with the full support of Duchy College and your employer. The fish frying advanced apprenticeship programme is supported and promoted by Seafish, the Seafood Training Academy and the National Federation of Fish Friers.

Apprenticeships are work-based training programmes; most of the training is 'on the job' - at the employers premises. The rest is provided by Duchy College , normally on a one day per week basis. Employment is expected to be for a minimum of 30 hours per week (which includes the college based element of the training).

An apprentice will benefit from:

  • Experiencing the work first-hand, as well as gaining a nationally recognised qualification
  • Meeting with potential employers and colleagues
  • Being able to guage for themselves if the job is for them

An employer will benefit from:

  • Increased productivity
  • Developing a skilled, motivated and qualified workforce
  • A financial return on investment

Units on the Level 3 advacned apprenticeship include:

  • Frying
  • Oil management
  • Planning
  • Customer service and food service operations
  • The science behind fish frying

Apprenticeships are primarily undertaken at the employer's workplace, with college attendance offered through block release provision predominantly at our Rosewarne or Stoke Climsland campuses, or at one of our outreach centres. A liaison officer will visit you at your workplace to support your learning, and offer you further support and guidance as required.
course.dc:subject: Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Fish Frying Advanced Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Fish Frying apprenticeship, earn while you learn.
course.learningOutcome: You could progress onto our FdSc Food Studies degree.
course.mlo:objective:
This apprenticeship is made up of two parts. One part is a number of general topics that are common to all apprenticeships in the UK, such as workplace food safety, workplace health and safety, first aid at work, hazard analysis and critical control points, functional skills (where applicable) employee rights and responsibilities, personal learning and thinking skills. The second part is then a Level 3 Fish and Shellfish Certificate.

The length of an apprenticeship varies depending on your prior skill levels, experience and the industry sector. Generally, apprenticeships offered by Duchy College take between one and two years to complete.
course.mlo:prerequisite: The only entry requirement is that an apprentice has to be employed and working in a fish frying business when starting the apprenticeship programme.

course.dc:description:
A food manufacturing apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.  An advanced apprenticeship is for people who have achieved a level 2 qualification eg 4 GCSE or an intermediate (level2) apprenticeship or similar.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.  Food Manufacturing apprenticeships are available with a wide range of specialisms such as bakery, butchery, meat processing, dairy, fish and beverages.
course.dc:subject: Food, Butchery, Drink, Milk, Cheese, Dairy, Meat, Fish, Bakery, Poultry, Manufacturing, Advanced Apprenticeship, Food Manufacturing, Level 3
Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Food Industry Skills Advanced Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: A food manufacturing apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: Achieving an Advanced Apprenticeship would enable you to progress onto one of our degree courses.
course.mlo:objective:
The Advanced Apprenticeship is composed of three separate areas which are: a food qualification specific to your area of the food industry; Personal Learning and Thinking Skills and Employment Rights and Responsibilities.  Additionally, if you do not have GCSE English and Maths, you will undertake key or functional skills.  Much of the learning on the course will take place at your place of work and will include the practical skills developed there and supported by specialist knowledge delivered by your work place mentor and our team of tutors.

The food qualification is made up of a combination of units of study to create a bespoke learning plan and the areas on offer include butchery, bakery, dairy, fish and seafood and food manufacturing excellence.  Within these units you will study subjects such as food safety and HACCP (hazard analysis) systems.

Some of the learning will also take place in College, either at our Rosewarne campus or at Stoke Climsland in the Food Manufacturing Centre.
course.mlo:prerequisite: A related Intermediate apprenticeship qualification or relevant level 2 qualification is essential - however, applicants with extensive relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered. You should also have 2 GCSEs at grade D or above, or a level 1 functional skills qualification and be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.learningOutcome:
With a Diploma in Spa Therapy, you could work in a variety of locations including salons, spas, resorts, health clubs, hotels, cruise ships or start your own business.

Working hours in the beauty industry are becoming more flexible with salons open longer hours during the week and over weekends.

You may be interested in studying further and enrol in specialise in a variety of treatments e.g. holistic therapies, nutrition, laser, skin care or dermatology. There is plenty of room for growth in the beauty industry and this apprenticeship is a good stepping stone in your career!
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the St Austell or Saltash campus 1 day a week for 1-2 years, depending on prior experience and qualifications.

During this apprenticeship you will build onto your Level 2 Diploma in Beauty or Nail Services and learn advanced techniques in spa therapy. You will:

  • Learn body massage, stone therapy treatments, head massages and pre-blended aromatherapy oil massage
  • Learn to operate sauna, steam and hydrotherapy treatments and monitor clients undergoing these treatments
  • Contribute to the planning and implementation of promotional activities and material for the spa

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Spa Therapy
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this advanced apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within the beauty or holistics industry.  You must have completed a Level 2 Diploma in Beauty or Nail Services or have relevant experience.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you want to obtain an industry recognised gas qualification and become a Domestic Gas Heating Engineer.

You'll need:at least three GCSEs at grade C or above and to take an initial assessment.  You will also need to seek employment with a gas heating company, where you will work under supervision with a qualified person.

You'll learn: topics such as installation, commissioning, service and maintenance techniques, health and safety, the combustion and poperties of gas, and building services and structures.

Expect: to attend college one day a week for the 3-year duration of the course.  There will also be block weeks to complete the practical elements.  You will be given training on both theory and practical on all units throughout the course, You will take assessments which consist of pracical elements, examinations and assignments, and will need to collect evidence in the workplace.

You'll love: learning the skills to gain an excellent career opportunity in an exciting and ever evolving industry.

You'll go onto: employment or study for additional gas qualifications to further your knowledge, experience and employability within the industry.
course.dc:subject: Gas, Apprenticeship, Level 3
Apprenticeships
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Gas Apprenticeship Level 3
course.abstract: Gas Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: After completing the course, you will be a gas safe registered engineer, qualified to work on gas boilers and water heaters ( natural and LPG ). Following this, you can add space heating and gas cookers as extras.
course.mlo:objective:
Study will be from the very basics of where natural gas comes from and how it gets to domestic properties and into appliances, to learning how appliances work and how to repair them. Central heating, gas utilisation, water heaters, gas fires and cookers will be explored. You will be assessed through a number of online exams, workshop practical assessments, workplace assessments and culminate with the equivalent of ACS gas assessment.

This programme has some plumbing elements - you will still need a good level of competence in pipework installation and understand the fundamentals and design of plumbing systems.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
It is preferable that you have a good sound English and maths background, with GCSE's at grade C and above.

Previous other qualifications will be considered, all candidates will have an initial assessment and interview.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in Hairdressing. You must enjoy working within a salon environment and enjoy working on a one to one basis with clients.
course.dc:subject: hairdressing, hair, hairdresser, cutting, apprenticeship, salon, level 2
Hair & Beauty
Apprenticeships
course.dc:title: Hairdressing Apprenticeship Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma in Hairdressing, you become a qualified Junior Stylist and can work in salons or hotels. In the future, you may be interested in studying further and enrol on the Level 3 Hairdressing Apprenticeship, where you will cover the more advanced colour and cutting techniques.

Thereafter, you could progress to a Level 4 Salon Management Apprenticeship, a cutting course in London or branch out and enrol in the Barbering Apprenticeship at Cornwall College Business.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne, St Austell and Saltash campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will work as a salon junior booking appointments and performing shampooing, conditioning, drying, styling and colouring of hair. You will also be involved in hair and skin testing and the principles of hair colour selection for clients.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will awarded the following qualification:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Hairdressing
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed within a salon environment. You must have a suitable level of fitness to perform some aspects of the job, as you will be on your feet most of the day.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:description:
Have you considered a 4 week course in preparing for the world of work in Health and Social Care?

If so, this course is for you. The course provides mandatory training to develop your knowledge and skills, in a variety of health and social care subjects. 

 

This next stage is the Intermediate Level 2 Apprenticeship in Health and Social Care

This course is aimed at 16 - 19 years who wish to pursue a career in Health and Social Care, where applicable, some students will be required to complete GSCE's in English and Math at grade C.
course.dc:title: Health and Social Care - Intermediate Apprenticeship Level 2 (Adult pathway)
course.mlo:objective:
Preparing for the world of work course

The training will consist of Health and Safety, Manual Handling, Dementia Awareness, End of life Care, Functional Skills in literacy and numeracy which will continue throughout the Apprenticeship.

Work placement opportunities to develop your employability skills.

 

Intermediate Level 2 Apprenticeship in Health and Social Care (Adults pathway)

Approximately 14 days in college which will delivery the components of the Apprenticeship:

Employer Rights and Responsibilities

Level 2 Certificate in Preparing to Work in Adult Social Care

Functional skills - literacy and numeracy

Level 2 Diploma in Health and Social Care.
course.mlo:prerequisite: This course is aimed at 16 - 19 years who wish to pursue a career in Health and Social Care, where applicable, some students will be required to complete GSCE's in English and Math at grade C.

course.dc:description: The apprenticeship is for any one working within the fast fit area (carrying out repairs to tyres exhaust brakes and steering and suspension) who would like to gain a Nationally recognised qualification at level 2 with in the fast fit industry. This is a two year course that will include one day a week at college to cover the under pinning knowledge and the work place to prove practical competence.
course.dc:title: Fast Fit Apprenticeship Level 2
course.mlo:objective: This programme provides skills, competence and knowledge required by those working in Fast Fit Automotive Environment. It will improve the quality of the work in the workplace and therefore customer satisfaction. The Apprenticeship covers areas including Health, Safety and Good housekeeping in the Automotive Environment, Identifying and Agreeing Motor Vehicle Customer Service Needs, Inspection, Repair and Replacement of High Performance Light Vehicle Tyres, Commercial Vehicle Tyres and Motorcycle Tyres, Light Vehicle Four Wheel Alignment and Inspection, Testing and Replacement of Vehicle Batteries and Related Components.  Delivered via Cornwall College Motor Vehicle Department, assessments and online tests and at the employer for practical skills and some assessments.

Ideal if: you want to train on the job and gian a nationally recognised qualification in furniture making.

You'll need: to have good practical and hand skills, be able to follow technical drawings accurately and have good attention to detail.  This course supports those working in a trainee furniture making position.

You'll learn:  the process behind the production of furniture, working with natural and manufactured materials.  During this apprenticeship you wok on training puieces then progress to making a cabinet and side table.  You will compile a competance portfolio to evidence your daily task, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Expect: to attend the workshop on campus for one day a week, with the remainder of the week spent in the workplace.  During this time you will gain a wide variety of skills associated with the making of high quality hand crafted furniture.

You'll love: acquiring the skills to produce beautiful pieces of furniture whilst working alongside other dedicated craftspeople.

You'll go onto: employment, a higher level apprenticeship or further study at level 3.
course.dc:subject: furniture, handcrafted, wood, construction, timber, apprenticeship, bench, joinery, carpentry, city and guilds, city & guilds, CG, C&G
Apprenticeships
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Furniture Making Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This furniture making apprenticeship is ideal for those who want to train on the job and gain nationally recognised qualifications.
course.mlo:assessment: You will be required to put together a portfolio of evidence to show your competence at your everyday tasks, and make a series of training pieces in the college workshop.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you can start working towards the nationally recognised Level 3 Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship. Thereafter, you could work as a restorer, hand crafted furniture maker, french polisher, furniture development technician, senior furniture designer, teacher or start your own business.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, wood machining or carpentry and joinery apprenticeship. Alternatively, the full time FdA Creative Practice course may interest you, where you can specialise in furniture design.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will carry out a series of practical training pieces before progressing on to making a cabinet and a side table. You will learn the process behind the production of standard items of furniture and work with natural and manufactured materials while reading and producing technical drawings.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Furniture Making (QCF)
  • Certificate in Furniture Production
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C and be employed in a suitable position.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

You'll need: good practical skills, to be able to follow technical drawings and work carefully and methodically

Engineering
course.dc:title: Performing Engineering Operations Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job to become a qualified Engineer
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma in Performing Engineering Operations, you are qualified to the level of a a junior craftsperson and may progress to a more senior position with more responsibility. Thereafter you can start working towards the Level 3 Diploma, where you can select from Engineering Maintenance, Fabrication and Welding, and Mechanical Manufacturing.

This course could be the foundation in your career, and in the future you could work as an electrical engineering technician, electronic engineering technician, engineering craft/CNC machinist, engineering maintenance fitter, engineering operative, mechanical engineering technician, metals industry production operative, project manager or programme director.

You may be interested in studying further and completing a Diploma in Engineering Leadership, Diploma in Business Improvement, Diploma in People Management, an HNC in Engineering or an FdSc Engineering.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne or St Austell campus 1 day per week for 2 years.

During this apprenticeship you will have the opportunity to select your pathway to suit your job e.g. engineering practices or technical support. You may produce models/drawings on a CAD system and use a variety of applications e.g. fabrication and welding or maintenance engineering.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Performing Engineering Operations
  • Level 2 EAL Diploma in Engineering and Technology
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, ideally have a minimum of 5 GCSEs at Grade C (preferably English, Maths and IT) and be employed within a suitable position.  

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Liaison Officers on 0800 731 7594.

This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job and gain a nationally recognised qualification in wood machining.

You must have good practical and hand skills, be able to follow technical drawings accurately and have good attention to detail. This course supports those working as a trainee wood machinist.

course.dc:title: Wood Machining Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: This apprenticeship is designed for people who want to train on the job.
course.learningOutcome:
With a Level 2 Diploma, you can start working towards the nationally recognised Level 3 Wood Machining Diploma by enrolling in the advanced apprenticeship.  Thereafter, you could work as a wood machinist, CNC programmer, technician, quality assurance manager, supervisor, designer or teacher.

In the future, you may be interested in continuing your apprenticeship studies through Cornwall College Business and enrol in the team leading, people management, level 4 site supervision, carpentry and joinery or furniture making apprenticeship. Alternatively, the full time BTEC Diploma in Construction and Built Environment or the FdSc Sustainable Construction course may interest to you, both are offered by Cornwall College.
course.mlo:objective:
You will attend lectures at the Camborne campus 1 day per week for 2 years, while the remainder of the week is spent in the workplace.

During this apprenticeship you will learn the correct methods for setting out joinery and using wood machines to current legislation. You will produce sawn, planed, profiled, jointed, sanded and bored timber, and timber based products using CNC/NC machines.

Depending on your job role and industry, you may have the opportunity to work on a variety of products e.g. desks, doors, stairs or floorboards.

You will put together a portfolio of evidence to show that you are competent at the tasks you do every day, while receiving support from experienced Cornwall College tutors.

Upon successful completion, you will be awarded the following qualifications:

  • NVQ Diploma in Woodmachining (Construction/Sawmilling)
  • Level 2  Diploma in Woodmachining QCF

Ideal if: you would like a great starting point for a career in the construction plant industry

You'll need: to be employed in a relevant role, and hold GCSEs at grade C or above, or an equivalent qualification

You'll learn: from a variety of modules covering topics such as servicing and maintenance, removing and replacing components, routine inspections, diagnosing faults, soldering and welding

Expect: a workplace assessor to help you build your portfolio of evidence

You'll love: learning the skills and knowledge necessary to further your employment in this industry

You'll go onto: employment, or an apprenticeship such as our level 3 Construction Plant Maintenance
course.dc:subject: plant engineering construction digger diggers tractor service mechanic, service, fix plant maintenance engineering mechanic
Apprenticeships
Construction Trades
course.dc:title: Plant Maintenance Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Plant Maintenance Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: After completeing this course, you may progress onto the Advanced Apprenticeship and complete the Level 3 NVQ Diploma in Plant Maintenance.
course.mlo:objective:
Completion of the Level 2 Apprenticeship can take up to 2 years. The Level 2 NVQ Diploma in Plant Maintenance requires 9 units, which include:

  • Servicing and Maintenance of Plant
  • Removing and Replacing Components
  • Dismantling and Assembly of Equipmemt
  • Maintaining the Work Area
  • Carry Out Routine inspection
  • Diagnosing Faults in Plant and Equipment
  • Repairing Equipment by Soldering and Welding Ferrous and Non-ferrous Materials
  • Manual Handling and Lifting Equipment
  • Testing of Equipment to Determine Serviceability
course.mlo:prerequisite: School leavers should ideally have GCSE grade C in maths, English and science, but support is available to those who need it. Those leaving further education to go into work, should have completed a relevant level 1 engineering qualification. Mature learners need to show a commitment to training and have an appropriate work history.

You'll need: to be currently employed or have an employer willing to take you on, and attend an informal interview to assess your interest in the course

You'll learn: how to operate a variety of equipment including excavators, forklifts, dumpers and road rollers

Expect: to complete theory and practical tests on four different types of construction plant

You'll love: learning the skills necessary to gain the Construction Plant Competence Certificate (CPCS) operator's card

You'll go onto: employment, or an apprenticeship such as our level 3 Construction Plant Operations

 

In order to complete this apprenticeship you must be employed in a role where you are operating construction plant machinery, eg. excavators, forklifts, tractors, road rollers, dumpers, loading shovels.

You will attend college one day per week.

course.dc:description:
An animal care apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility. You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.

Ideal if: you work in or would like to work in the animal management industry.

You'll need: two GCSEs at grade D or above, or relevant prior experience.

You'll need: to be employed in the industry, but if you are not, we may be able to help you find an employer.

You'll learn: to develop and demonstrate competence in a range of areas which may include promoting and maintaining health and well-being; animal handling and grooming, assisting in the movement of animals, customer care, information and advice, delivering basic treatment to animals and housing, hygiene and maintenance.

Expect: to spend one day each week at one of the Duchy College campus sites, and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics. You'll love earning money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects, progress onto further study on courses such as the Animal Management City & Guilds Subsidiary or Extended Diploma or an animal management advanced apprenticeship.
course.dc:subject: animals, care, animal care, caring, zoo, zookeeper, warden, zoo warden, animal carer
Apprenticeships
Animal Management & Veterinary Nursing
course.dc:title: Animal Management Intermediate Apprenticeship
course.abstract: An animal care apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills or progress onto the advanced work based diploma in animal care, further or higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
This level can take up to two years to complete where you will work towards the Level 2 Diploma in Work-based Animal Care.  On this programme you will develop and demonstrate competence in a range of areas, which may include:

• Promoting and maintaining health and wellbeing
• Providing food and water
• Housing and cleanliness
• Animal handling and grooming
• Assisting in the movement of animals
• Customer care, information and advice
• Developing personal performance and positive working relationships
• Delivering basic treatment to animals
• Health and safety
• Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
• Emergency first aid
• Employment rights and responsibilities

These apprenticeships are delivered at one of Duchy College's campuses either at Stoke Climsland, Rosewarne or an industry based venue.  This normally means one day each week spent at college and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer. 

You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will also visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

CE:cost.dc:description: Please call our Enquiries Team for more details on this course.

course.dc:description:
A floristry apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.
course.dc:subject: apprenticeships, apprentice, florist, flowers, flower arranging, plants, florists, plant arranging,
Floristry
course.dc:title: Floristry Apprenticeship
course.abstract: A floristry apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical floristry skills, progress onto the advanced work based diploma or further your educational opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
This level can take up to two years to complete where you will work towards a Level 2 Diploma in Work-based Floristry.  On this programme you will develop and demonstrate competence in the following areas:

  • Practical floristry skills
  • Flower and plant care
  • Identify, check and monitor cut materials
  • Plan, prepare and assemble floristry designs and arrangements
  • Display stock to promote sales and optimise value
  • Maintain condition and appearance
  • Monitor and maintain health and safety standards
  • Support customer care and effective working relationships
  • Personal performance
  • Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
  • Emergency first aid
  • Employment rights and responsibilities

These apprenticeships are delivered at Rosewarne. This normally means one day each week at college and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer.

You will be assigned a Liaison Officer who will also visit you at your workplace to offer you further support and guidance.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:description:
Upon successful completion of this apprenticeship the participant will have a competent understanding in the following areas:  

  • Understanding the sales environment
  • Understanding sales techniques and processes   
  • Understanding the legal, regulatory and ethical requirements in Sales
  • Principals of personal responsibilities and working in a business environment.  
  • Understanding sales target
  • Understanding business awareness in sales
This programme is ideal for those moving up the career ladder or looking to develop some specialist skills such as understanding buyer behaviour or face to face selling.
course.dc:subject: sales, apprenticeship, level 2, retail
course.dc:title: Sales Apprenticeship Level 2
course.mlo:objective:
The Cornwall College Business Sales Apprenticeship provides those who are embarking in a new career in sales with the knowledge and skills needed to progress within a sales and telesales profession. The areas covered range from generating and qualifying sales leads, building rapport with customers to negotiating and closing sales. The Sales & Telesales workforce is one of the largest professional groups in the UK today, employing around 7% of the UK workforce, or just over two million people.  

In addition, there are many more non-specialists for whom selling is an essential part of their job role – particularly within the four million small and medium sized enterprises in the UK.  

The course provides employers of all sizes and across all sectors in England with a high quality, nationally recognised programme which will attract new talent into Sales and Telesales and up skill the existing workforce to make businesses more productive, efficient and profitable.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
To enrol in this apprenticeship, you need to be aged 16 and over, have a minimum of 2 GCSEs at Grade C (ideally in English and Maths) and be employed in an administrative role.

If you are interested in this apprenticeship and do not have the required GCSEs or an employer, speak to one of our Cornwall College Business Customer Advisors on 0800 731 7594.

course.dc:description: The Land-based Service Engineering Apprenticeship is available to people of all ages who are employed maintaining and servicing agricultural or groundcare equipment.
course.dc:subject: agriculture, farming, farmer, tractor, fixing, diggers, 360s, engineering, engineer, land-based, landbased, horticulture, groundcare, estate management, groundwork, land, farmland, fields,
Land-based Engineering & Construction Plant
course.dc:title: Land-Based Service Engineering Apprenticeship
course.abstract: Land-Based Service Engineering Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: Learners with proven ability at level 2 can progress into the Advanced Apprenticeship and complete the Level 3 Diploma in Landbased Engineering Operations
course.mlo:objective:
Completion of the Level 2 Apprenticeship can take up to 2 years. The Level 2 Diploma in Land-based Engineering Operations covers 14 units.

  • Monitor and Maintain Health and Safety
  • Applying Mechanical Principles
  • Service and Maintain Tools and Equipment
  • Material Preparation, Shaping and Assembly
  • Servicing and Maintenance on Landbased Equipment
  • Thermal Cutting and Joining Processes
  • Service and Repair Cooling and Lubrication Systems
  • Service and Repair Electrical Systems
  • Service and Repair Hydraulic Systems
  • Maintain and Develop Personal Performance
  • Establish and Maintain Effective Working Relationships With Others
  • Service and Repair Engines and Components
  • Service and Repair Mechanical Transmission Systems
  • Service and Repair Soil Preparation and Plant Establishment Equipment

Key Skills or Functional Skill in Application of Number, Communication and ICT are required at Level 1.

The attendance pattern and duration depends on previous experience but the programme is likely to require at least one day attendance per week for up to two years.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:description:
An agriculture apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.

Ideal if: you are or would like to be employed in agriculture.

You'll need: two GCSEs at grade D or above, or relevant prior experience and to be employed in the industry. If not, we may be able to help you find an employer.

You'll learn: crop or animal husbandry, depending on which apprenticeship route you choose, and other areas including tractor and machinery use and maintenance, nutrition, health and welfare, crop cultivation, harvesting and storage, health and safety, environment and conservation and welding.

Expect: to work with your employer for most of the week, attending college one day per week to cover 50% practical and 50% theory work. You'll also work towards a level 2 Functional Skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You'll love: the chance to earn money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You'll go onto: improve your promotion prospects, progress to an advanced apprenticeship or full-time study on our Agriculture City & Guilds Extended Diploma.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.

Agriculture

course.abstract: An agriculture apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your basic craft skills or progress onto the advanced work based diploma in agriculture, further or higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective: On a day release basis (one day per week) at the College, covering 50% practical and 50% theory work. Depending on which apprenticeship route you choose, you will study crop or animal husbandry covering such areas as tractor and machinery use and maintenance, nutrition, health and welfare, cultivations, harvesting and storage for a range of crops, basic records, health and safety, environment and conservation and welding.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.
course.dc:subject: hort, flowers, plants, gardens, garden design, botany, landscape gardener, gardener, horticulturalist, apprentice, apprenticeship,
Apprenticeships
Horticulture
course.dc:title: Horticulture Apprenticeship
course.abstract: A horticulture apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills or progress onto the advanced work based diploma in horticulture, further or higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
This level can take up to two years to complete where you will work towards a Level 2
Diploma in Work-based Horticulture.  On this programme you will develop and demonstrate competence in the following areas:

• Establish plants and seeds in soil
• Establish decorative amenity areas
• Identify the health and maintain the condition of general amenity turf
• Monitor and maintain health and safety
• Levelling and preparing sites for landscaping
• Plant terminology and identification
• Use and maintain non-powered and hand held powered tools and equipment
• Installing flagstone surfaces
• Construct water features
• Industry based training appropriate to your employment
• Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
• Emergency first aid
• Employment rights and responsibilities

A wider choice of units and pathways are available to match the experience of the candidate and their employment, based on an initial assessment.

Pathways include:
Horticulture
Landscaping
Production Horticulture
Parks, Gardens and Green Space

These apprenticeships are delivered at one of Duchy College's campuses either at Stoke
Climsland or Rosewarne. This normally means one day each week spent at college and the remaining four days in the workplace with your employer.

You will be assigned an assessor who will also visit you at your workplace to monitor your progress, assess the training undertaken in the workplace and work through targets for the next review.
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.

course.dc:description:
A butchery apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.
course.dc:subject: butcher, apprentice, apprenticeship, animal, abatoire, butchers
Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Butchery Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: A butchery apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical butchery skills or explore further education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
The overall butchery apprenticeship training provision focuses on enhancing the learner's ability to practice specialist industry skills and to consistently demonstrate appropriate levels of competence.  This is delivered with the ongoing support of our dedicated team members, offering guidance to both the learner and the employer.

Programme content:
• Induction
• Emergency First Aid Certificate
• Level 2 in Food Safety
• Level 2 in Health and Safety
• Butchery Skills (knife cutting skills)
• Functional Skills or Key Skills (where appropriate)
• Employer Rights and Responsibilities

Level 2 Certificate for Proficiency in Meat and Poultry, with choices offered in:
 - Meat and Poultry Processing Skills
 - Butchery Retail Skills

As part of the underpinning structure, we actively encourage our apprentices to participate in our educational visits to an:
- Livestock farm
- Abattoir ~ to reflect on the wider process 'from farm to fork'
- Cutting plant ~ to witness the butchery process on a large scale

The above is intended to give support, aiding the learner's principal understanding towards animal welfare, the slaughter process, meat hygiene regulations and the grading of differing carcasses.

Progression and achievement is primarily structured through the collection of project evidence, short course certificates, witness testimonies, observations and direct questioning techniques.  A judgement is then made to determine the individual's overall knowledge, practical skill and capability.

Butchery apprenticeships are primarily undertaken at the learner's workplace, with college attendance through block relea

course.dc:description:
Ideal if: you want to become a qualified engineer, this apprenticeship provides an ideal foundation for a wide range of occupations within the engineering field.

You'll need: to be employed in a relevant role and ideally have three GCSEs at grade C or above in English, mathematics and IT.  You must have good practical skills, be able to follow technical drawings and work carefully and methodically.

You'll learn: modules including fabrication and welding, maintenance engineering and machining.

Expect: to have the opportunity to tailor your learning to suit your job.

You'll love: learning a whole new range of skills.

You'll go onto: an engineering advanced apprenticeship, or further study at level 3 such as our Engineering Extended Diploma.

course.dc:description:
A food manufacturing apprenticeship is the ideal way to earn money whilst gaining a nationally recognised qualification. The provision is open to anyone aged 16+ years provided that you meet current eligibility.

You must be fully employed in your chosen career path and hold a genuine interest in your area of work, demonstrating enthusiasm and a strong determination to succeed.

Ideal if: you are already or would like to be employed in the food and drink industry.

You’ll need: two GCSEs at grade D or above, although relevant prior experience will be considered.

You’ll learn: the principles of working in food manufacture, safe preparation, food processing, how to monitor and maintain product quality and food hygiene.

Expect: a wide range of work-based activities to help you understand the systems essential for good practice, safe preparation and processing in line with the quality standards demanded by industry and today’s customers. You'll also work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and mathematics.

You’ll love: earning money while gaining a nationally recognised qualification.

You’ll go onto: improve your promotion prospects or progression to the Food and Drink Manufacturing advanced apprenticeship.
course.dc:subject: food, food production, food manufacture, food technology, food tech, butchers, apprentice, apprenticeships
Apprenticeships
Catering & Hospitality
Food Manufacturing & Technology
course.dc:title: Food Industry Skills Apprenticeship Level 2
course.abstract: Work-based Food Manufacturing Apprenticeship
course.learningOutcome: On successful completion you can commence work in the industry using your practical skills or progress onto the advanced work-based diploma in Food Manufacturing or further / higher education opportunities.
course.mlo:objective:
The programme contains a wide range of work-based activities that help you to appreciate the systems that are essential for good practice, safe preparation and processing. These are operated in accordance to the quality standards demanded by industry and by today's customers.

The overall food manufacturing apprenticeship provision focuses on enhancing your ability to practice specialist industry skills and to consistently demonstrate appropriate levels of competence.  This is delivered with the ongoing support of our dedicated team members, offering guidance to both the learner and employer.

You will undertake a Level 2 Certificate for Proficiency in Food Manufacture, with choices offered in:

  • Distribution skills
  • Operational skills
  • Craft Bakery skills
  • Process Bakery skills
  • Production Control skills
  • Brewing Industry Skills
  • Fish & Shellfish Industry Skills
  • Butchery Industry Skills
  • Food Manufacturing Excellence / Lean Manufacturing

Programme content includes:

  • Principles of working in food manufacture
  • Essential areas of production
  • Systems for good practice
  • Monitor and maintain product quality
  • Safe preparation
  • Food processing
  • Control mixing and size reduction
  • Monitor and maintain product quality
  • Food hygiene
  • Maintain workplace food safety
  • Uphold workplace health and safety in food manufacture
  • Diagnose and rectify operating problems
  • Organisation and continuity in the workplace
  • Emergency first aid course
  • Level 2 Award in Food Safety
  • Level 2 Award in Health and Safety
  • Functional skills or key skills (where applicable)
course.mlo:prerequisite: 2 GCSEs at grade D or above are essential - however, applicants with relevant prior experience but without the stated qualifications will be considered, and must be prepared to work towards a level 2 functional skills qualification in English and Maths.
