course.dc:description:
You will be required to find a suitable animal-based work placement which you can attend on a regular basis to complete the 300 hours of work experience necessary to undertake this course. You will also need to purchase protective clothing, ordered through the College at a discounted rate.  There are regular trips and visits to animal-based organisations and the approximate cost of a two day visit away is £100.


If you are over 19 year old you will need to pay tuition fees, although there are concessions if this is your first full level 3 qualification, or if you are claiming means-tested benefits.  Please contact our Admissions Office for full details.

This course is for anyone with sound academic ability who wishes to study a vocational qualification, which is mostly theory-based with some practical input.  The course allows you to gain a supervisory level qualification which will enhance your employability in the animal industry.
course.dc:subject: animal zoo animals
course.dc:title: Animal Management City & Guilds Advanced Technical Certificate Level 3
course.learningOutcome: This qualification is the equivalent of three A-levels and provides a sound entry route to Higher Education.  You may wish to study at Foundation Degree or Degree level and there are a variety of  these Higher Education courses available for progression at Cornwall College Newquay, at Plymouth University and elsewhere at universities out of the county.  Alternatively you may progress into employment within the animal industry with the skills and knowledge to develop working at a supervisory level.
course.mlo:objective:
Attendance is three days per week over two years, during which time you will cover the following subject areas:  animal health; accommodation; feeding; animal handling and safe working; anatomy and physiology; animal biology; research investigation project and work experience.

There are also some optional units which may include:  animal behaviour and communication; welfare and breed development; business management; exotic pet health and husbandry; wildlife management and rehabilitation; animal training; nutrition and zoological animal health and husbandry.

You will be assessed via an ongoing series of written assignments and practical assessments and you will be required to undergo a period of at least 300 hours of work experience, either as day release or in blocks.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You must have 5 GCSEs at Grade C or above in English, science and maths, a good attendance record at school and demonstrate a sound commitment to working with animals.  You may also be required to provide a reference from your school tutor or from your work place.  You may also progress onto this course with a  Level 2 Diploma in Animal Management (at Merit and Distinction level).  For students aged 19+, your prior experience with animals and academic qualifications will be taken into consideration at interview.

presentation.dc:title: Animal Management City & Guilds Advanced Technical Certificate Level 3

course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Make a Silver Bangle and Charm in a day
course.abstract: During this one day jewellery workshop you will leave with a finished item.
course.learningOutcome: You can do one of our other jewellery workshops or try the 10 week Jewellery Making Beginners course.
course.mlo:objective: During these one day workshops you are guaranteed to leave with a finished silver  pendant  to wear yourself or give to someone as a gift.  Throughout the day you will learn basic jewellery techniques, such as piercing (sawing), soldering, texturing, sizing, filing and polishing.  We will be adding textures/patterns by using materials such as, lace, netting, feather, leaves, wallpaper etc. Please bring along of these with you if you have something in particular you would like to try.  You will all be given a suggested list of items to buy for your own jewellery tool kit so that you can continue to create beautiful silver jewellery from home.    This class is a great introduction to working with silver and can be followed by our Jewellery Making Beginners course.

course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Make a Silver Pendant in a day
course.abstract: During this one day jewellery workshop you will leave with a finished item.
course.learningOutcome: You can do one of our other jewellery workshops or try the 10 week Jewellery Making Beginners course.
course.mlo:objective: During these one day workshops you are guaranteed to leave with a finished silver  pendant  to wear yourself or give to someone as a gift.  Throughout the day you will learn basic jewellery techniques, such as piercing (sawing), soldering, texturing, sizing, filing and polishing.  We will be adding textures/patterns by using materials such as, lace, netting, feather, leaves, wallpaper etc. Please bring along of these with you if you have something in particular you would like to try.  You will all be given a suggested list of items to buy for your own jewellery tool kit so that you can continue to create beautiful silver jewellery from home.    This class is a great introduction to working with silver and can be followed by our Jewellery Making Beginners course.

course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Cake Decorating & Making Workshops (JP)
course.abstract: Learn how to decorate and make great cakes
course.learningOutcome: You can book onto one of our other leisure courses or workshops.
course.mlo:objective:
Wired Roses - Sugar Flower Workshop

Join Claire from The Strand Cakery to learn how to make beautiful wired roses and leaves with flower paste. You'll learn how to make realistic looking flowers, buds and leaves and learn the principles of colouring and assembling your creations. Packed full of tips and tricks of the trade this workshop is suitable for all levels.

Summer Gateaux - Baking and Decorating Workshop

Join Claire from The Strand Cakery to learn how to bake and decorate a layered Strawberry Gateau. You'll bake a delicious sponge from scratch, slice it into 3 layers, macerate strawberries for the filling, pipe Chantilly cream and make simple chocolate decorations to create an stunning dessert to impress your family and friends with. Packed full of hints, tips and tricks of the trade, this workshop is perfect for beginners to build confidence in baking and decorating.

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.
This course is for people who have fire safety responsibilities at work, particularly those tasked with carrying out fire risk assessments and preventing loss of life and property.
course.dc:subject: NEBOSH, Fire Safety, Risk Management, Certificate, nebosh, National, health and safety
Health & Social Care
Business, Administration & Law
course.dc:title: Fire Safety and Risk Management NEBOSH National Certificate Level 3
course.learningOutcome: Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course covers the main legal requirements for safety in the UK as stated in the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order, principles of fire and explosion, causes and prevention of fires, fire protection in buildings and ensuring the safety of people in the event of a fire. Crucially the practical element of the course also ensures that participants can carry out unaided a fire risk assessment and prepare a recommendations report for management.

It is classroom based and involves tutor lead discussions and presentations, group work involving research and feedback, plus individual learning.

You will receive a comprehensive course book which covers the whole syllabus, to aid group work and private study.

Candidates are assessed on completion of the course on dates set nationally by NEBOSH, successful candidates will be awarded with a unit certificate, and a certificate parchment is issued on successful completion of all units including NGC1 of the NEBOSH General Certificate.
course.mlo:prerequisite: To enrol on this course candidates will already have gained a level 2 (or equivalent) award in health and safety.

presentation.dc:subject: Health & Social Care
Business, Administration & Law
presentation.dc:title: Fire Safety and Risk Management NEBOSH National Certificate Level 3

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.

This course is ideally suited for managers, supervisors and employees who are responsible for managing environmental issues in the workplace.

Students who wish to progress onto the NEBOSH National Diploma in Environmental Management will need to complete this course first.
course.dc:subject: environment, management, nebosh, general certifcate, environmental, health officer, agriculture, nebosh, General Certificate
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Environmental Management NEBOSH National Certificate Level 3
course.mlo:objective:
The course covers a range of topics including:

  • Foundations in environmental management
  • UK environmental law
  • Types of environmental management system
  • Environmental impact assessments
  • Control of emissions to air
  • Control of contamination of water resources
  • Control of waste and land use
  • Sources and uses of energy and energy efficiency
  • Control of environmental noise
  • Planning for and dealing with environmental emergencies

Environmental Management is a blended learning programme. Students will be expected to attend 6 taught sessions, which will be split across two weeks. The course is student focused and will include a range of research activities and worked based case studies.

In addition the students will be required to complete 25 hours of directed private study. This will be a mixture of textbook reading, moodle activities and wider research. To ensure the students complete the private study they will be given a study diary to complete.

The students will also be required to complete a practical application which requires them to conduct an environmental review of their own workplace.
course.mlo:prerequisite:
The NEBOSH General Certificate in Occupational Health and Safety would be advantageous.

All students will be required to complete a pre-enrolment form and telephone interview with the tutor to assess the students suitability for the course prior to course acceptance.

Students should hold a Level 2 ICT qualification or be able to evidence that they are computer literate, due to the blended learning requirement of this course.

presentation.dc:subject: Health & Social Care
presentation.dc:title: Environmental Management NEBOSH National Certificate Level 3

course.dc:description:
Delegates will need to pay a registration fee to CIPS and pay relevant exam and Study Guide fees for each module in addition to the fee quoted.

To enable entry to exams, each student must register with CIPS and pay their student membership fee.

Typical job titles:

  • Buyer
  • Procurement / purchasing executive
  • Procurement specialist
  • Contract officer
  • Supply chain / inventory / logistics analyst
  • Supply chain / inventory / logistics planner
course.dc:subject: procurement supply advanced diploma level 4, cips, chartered institute purchasing supply, CIPS
course.dc:title: Procurement and Supply CIPS Advanced Diploma Level 5
course.learningOutcome:
Core skills upon completion of this qualification provision of advice and guidance to key stakeholders on the performance of organisational procedures and processes in procurement and supply.

Individuals may move on to Level 6 Professional Diploma in Procurement and Supply.
course.mlo:objective:
This course will cover the mandatory units:

  • Management in procurement and supply
  • Managing risks in supply chains
  • Improving the competitiveness of supply chains

You will also cover optional units:

  • Category management in procurement and supply
  • Sustainability in supply chains
  • Operations management in supply chains

Each unit is delivered as a 2-day taught module, followed by a 1-day revision session one month later in readiness for the exam the following month.

We believe that this approach is superior to other methods in the following ways:

  • The students commit to 3 intensive training days rather than endless evenings at night school
  • The support of a dedicated tutor team
  • Focus and momentum in the learning
  • Students are guided by the best trainers in the country, of which 2 are CIPS assessors
  • 5 modules in a year ensures rapid progression.

Full details of the programme can be found at the CIPS website by following the link below:

http://www.cips.org/Documents/Qualifications/Unit_Content_Guides/CIPS_AdDipProcSupp_AW%20FINAL.pdf
course.mlo:prerequisite: You will need to have achieved the CIPS Diploma in procurement and supply.

course.dc:title: Procurement and Supply CIPS Professional Diploma Level 6
course.learningOutcome:
Core skills upon completion of this qualification ability to formulate direction and advice; change management; leading and influencing both internal and external stakeholders in procurement and supply and the management of teams and individuals.

On successful completion of the Diploma, Advanced and Professional diplomas along with 3 years' experience in a postion of responsiblility in procurement and supply you will be awarded MCIPS status.
course.mlo:objective:
The course covers the mandatory units:

  • Leadership in procurement and supply
  • Corporate and business strategy
  • Strategic supply chain management

and the optional units:

  • Supply chain diligence
  • Programme and project management
  • Legal aspects in procurement and supply (UK)

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.

This two day Adobe Intermediate training course is for anyone wanting to improve their Photoshop skills. It is an intensive tutor led course, delivered by an Adobe Certified tutor which incorporates a substantial amount of hands on training.

The courses are normally delivered at Cornwall College Camborne or St Austell but can be delivered at other locations, including company premises, subject to a viable number of delegates.
course.dc:subject: adobe, creative suite, photoshop, dreamweaver, indesign, illustrator, web design, website design, graphic design, photography manipulation
Information & Communication Technology
course.dc:title: Adobe CS Photoshop (Intermediate)
course.learningOutcome:
Move on to demonstrate that you have the skills needed to get the most out of Adobe software by completing other Intermediate Courses in Photoshop, InDesign, Dreamweaver, Illustrator and also Word Press.

Diversify your digital skills through our suite of Microsoft Office Specialist Courses in Project, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access, Word and Excel all at introduction and intermediate levels, with Word and Excel at Expert/Advanced Level.
course.mlo:objective:
You will learn how to use Adobe Photoshop to obtain, enhance and present digital images by:

  • Setting Project Requirements
  • Identifying Design Elements When Preparing Images
  • Understanding Adobe Photoshop®
  • Manipulating Images
  • Publishing Digital Images
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal qualifications required for this course, however delegates should have familiarity with the fundamentals of Photoshop and ideally will have previously completed the Introductory course or have similar levels of skills and experience.

course.dc:description: This qualification is for the development of the role and skills of managers. This qualification aim to develop personal management capabilities, make effective use of information in decision-making, operations and the development of the skills in managing people.
course.dc:subject: leadership, management, CMI, team skills, future skills
course.dc:title: Management and Leadership CMI Award Level 5
course.mlo:objective:
The criteria of the assessment of a CMI Level 5 qualification (QCF) will be to meet the assessment criteria detailed within each individual unit.  The primary interface with the Learner is the Assessor whose job it is to assess the evidence presented by the Learner.

Typical units:   

  1. Conducting a management project    
  2. Planning for development    
  3. Operational risk management    
  4. Ethical organisational management    
  5. Managing ideas and innovation
course.mlo:prerequisite: This qualification can be offered to Learners from age 19. CMI does not specify entry requirements for these qualifications, but Centres are required to ensure that Learners admitted to the programme have sufficient capability at the right level to undertake the learning and assessment.

course.dc:title: Management and Leadership CMI Award Level 4
course.learningOutcome:
On successful completion of a Level 4 qualification in Management and Leadership, a number of progression opportunities become available:   

  • Enhance your professional status by upgrading your CMI membership   
  • Progress to other qualifications at the same level (e.g. from Level 4 Award to Level 4 Certificate etc.)   
  • Progress to other qualifications at the next level (e.g. from Level 4 Certificate to Level 5 or 6 Certificate)   
  • Apply to become a Chartered Manager
course.mlo:objective:
• Managing stakeholder expectations   
  • Understanding team dynamics   
  • Management report writing   
  • Introducing organisational culture, values and behaviour   
  • Being a leader

course.dc:subject: Cornwall College
course.dc:title: Introduction to Printing Seamless Repeat Patterns on Textiles
course.abstract: Students will be introduced to different methods of printing continuous and intricate pattern repeats onto cloth.
course.learningOutcome: After the course you could try one of our other leisure courses or workshops.
course.mlo:objective:
Students will be introduced to different methods of printing continuous and intricate pattern repeats onto cloth.  Using traditional techniques they will work on their own designs and print them on material using screens or blocks.  Teamwork is involved at the exciting printing stage when individual and unique designs are realised in lengths of about 3 metres.  

Dyes, printing pastes, tools and equipment are supplied. Students just need to bring their own fabric (of natural fibres).

Please wear old clothes or bring an apron to protect your clothes and wear sensible shoes (no open toe shoes).

This course is for people at any level in any sector who need an understanding of the essentials of health and safety.

This is a nationally recognised and respected certified training course.
course.dc:subject: Health and Safety, Risk Assessment, Risk management, Health in the work place, IOSH
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Working Safely IOSH Level 1
course.learningOutcome:
In the future, you could progress on to various Health and Safety courses.

Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course is 1 day and covers the following topics:

  • Introducing working safely
  • Defining hazard and risk
  • Identifying common hazards
  • Improving safety performance
  • Protecting our environment

This course is run as an interactive workshop, with animated graphics, board games and quizzes offering jargon-free technical content based on what people need to know in practice, and does not use off-putting legal language.

Assessment is built into the course through a work scenario risk assessment exercise and multi format written questions.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements for this course.

This course is for managers and supervisors/team leaders in any sector. It is designed to get managers up to speed on the practical actions they need to take to handle health and safety in their teams.
course.dc:subject: Iosh managing safely health and safety NEBOSH IOSH
Hair & Beauty
course.dc:title: Managing Safely IOSH Certificate
course.mlo:objective:
Tutor lead modules involving interactive presentations games and exercises covering the following topics:

  • Introducing managing safely
  • Assessing the risks
  • Controlling the risks
  • Understanding your responsibilities
  • Identifying hazards
  • Investigating accidents and incidents
  • Measuring performance
  • Protecting our environment

This course concludes with a final assessment on the last day, including a multi-format question paper and a work-based risk assessment.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no entry requirements for this course.

This course is for anyone in middle or top management wishing to develop knowledge and practice their skills in the work environment at a professional level. You should be responsible for developing and instigating new and amended policy and practice to ensure that your organisation complies with its legal obligations, whilst recognising cost and budgetary constraints.
course.dc:subject: occupational, health and safety, occupational health and safety, City & guilds, IOSH
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Occupational Health and Safety CG NVQ Diploma Level 5
course.mlo:objective:
This course is approximately two years and involves practical demonstrations in the workplace where complex health and safety risks occur.

You will be supported by a mentor through a series of work based projects, which are undertaken to demonstrate competence against national standards. You will need to allocate approximately 5 hours per week for research and implementation of improved practice required to gain the qualification.

Your mentor will support you through observations, validation of practice and professional discussions.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You must have gained an Occupational Health and Safety NEBOSH Certificate Level 3 or equivalent to enrol on this course.

course.dc:description: Contact us for more information.

This course is for anyone in a work environment as it raises learners’ awareness of the concept of risk assessment. 

“Principles of Risk Assessment CIEH Award Level 2” was created in response to industry requirements for all employees to be aware of risks. Although not all employees will be expected to undertake risk assessments themselves, they may be asked to contribute to the process and will be expected to protect their own health and safety and that of others.
course.dc:subject: Principles of Risk Assessment, CIEH, health and safety, first aid, chartered institute of environmental health, CIEH, H&S, award level 2
Health & Social Care
course.dc:title: Principles of Risk Assessment CIEH Award Level 2
course.learningOutcome:
In the future, you could enrol in the Risk Assessment in Principles and Practice CIEH Award Level 3.

Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course is run over one day and covers the following modules:

  • Contribution both to the maintenance of a safe work environment and to the process of formal risk assessment
  • The legal requirements for risk assessment
  • The principles of risk assessment including hazards, risks and control measures, 5 steps of risk assessment, the hierarchy of control and risk assessment, review and record keeping

It is run as an interactive workshop, which includes tutor lead sessions, group work exercises and general classroom discussions. You will be assessed by 30 multiple choice question paper.
course.mlo:prerequisite: There are no formal entry requirements for this course.

The course is assessed by a 30 multiple choice question paper.

This course is for all employees who handle materials, boxes, mail and packages, including both industrial and office workers.

This qualification complements the CIEH Level 2 Award in Health and Safety in the Workplace. Aimed at those who carry out manual handling at work, it introduces candidates to the risks of manual handling and the controls available.

The course is assessed by a 30 multiple choice question paper.

Health & Social Care

course.dc:title: Occupational Health and Safety NEBOSH National General Certificate Level 3
course.learningOutcome:
Upon completion, you will be assessed on dates set nationally by NEBOSH and awarded unit certificates; a certificate parchment is issued on successful completion of all three units.

This course meets the requirements for technical Membership of IOSH (Tech IOSH), and associate membership of International Institute of Risk and Safety Management (IIRSM).

In the future, you could go onto the next level of the Occupational Health and Safety Qualifications.

Cornwall College Business offers a wide range of courses in a variety of areas including Health and Safety, Construction, Management and Leadership, IT, Accounting, Finance and Legal. Our courses vary in length and can be tailored to suit your business needs. Contact us to discuss your options further.
course.mlo:objective:
This course covers the following modules:

  • Management of Health and Safety (NGC1)
  • Controlling workplace hazards (NGC2)
  • Health and safety practical application (NGC3)

Modules NGC1 and NGC2 are followed by written exams and NGC3 includes a practical workplace assessment. The course is run over 12 days with 3 block release periods each consisting of 4 days.

“Occupational Health and Safety NEBOSH Certificate Level 3” is classroom based and involves tutor lead discussions, presentations, group work involving research and feedback, and individual learning.

There is a comprehensive course book which covers the whole syllabus, to aid group work and private study.
course.mlo:prerequisite: You must have gained a Health and Safety Award Level 2 or equivalent to enrol on this course.
